Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive gem 1 block from Strip”
Reviews.Author: DanielMonkeyshines
Reviews.Content: Stayed here March 2012. Small by LV standards, about 9 floors. One block from Planet Hollywood, Harley Davidson Cafe, Cosmopolitan Hotel, etc. We paid only $630.00 for two people for airfare (Southwest) from Salt Lake plus four nights lodging. Our room was very clean and very attractive---apparently remodeled recently. We were on the fifth floor, right at the tops on the palm trees on the west side, and loved having birds chirp us awake in the mornings. Another plus is that the window actually opens, albeit only about 4 inches, so you can get fresh air instead of using the AC. If you want more flesh air, bring a small Vise-Grip or set of square-head nut drivers, and you should be able to remove the screws holding in place the wooden bar which prevents the window from opening fully. The outdoor pool was great: very clean, with a jacuzzi, loads of pool towels, showers and bathrooms. The pool does get shady about 3:00 p.m. thanks to the tall hotel to the west. (A plus if you want to avoid skin cancer; a minus if you want a tan.) Also, the staff was great. I went to iron a shirt, and found the face of the iron had some sticky substance on it. I found a maid in the hall and gave her the iron. Three minutes later, she was back with a brand-new iron, still in the box. Another example: On my way to the pool one day, I went to the ice machine on the ninth floor. It konked out after giving up only a cup of ice. I told the desk clerk and when I returned from the pool 30 minutes later, the ice machine was fixed. Our room had two queens, a kitchenette, flat screen TV, steam iron & board, and in-room safe. In the lobby is a concierge who can book shows, etc., a small selection of groceries and drug store items, two computers, and a TV room where they serve coffee etc. in the morning. A tennis court next to the pool. For us, we loved NOT having a casino or restaurant in the hotel. (No food smells or obnoxious slot machines, either.) The only negative was the typical hotel styrofoam pillows. If you want quiet, convenient, attractive, friendly, STAY HERE!!!! ----signed DT, your picky traveler from Salt Lake.

Reviews.Title: “A comforatable, quiet boutique hotel just off the exciting Las Vegas Strip!”
Reviews.Author: CanuckRedDeer_AB
Reviews.Content: Our family party of four adults stayed at the Carriage House Deluxe Suite Hotel from March 4 to March 7, 2012. The unit was located by researching Trip Advisor. At that time the Carriage House was listed as 6th of over 250 hotels in Las Vegas. This surprised us and made us wonder about the rating. We need not have worried as the Carriage House lived up to its high billing. It’s a fabulous place to stay! Small compared to some of the 6000 room behemoths but very quiet, comfortable and friendly and great value for the money. We were upgraded from a one bedroom, sleep four unit, to a two bedroom sleep four for the price of $99.00 per night. The units had recently received a renovation and looked like new. One unit had a sleep comfort queen sized bedroom while the room we were in had a Murphy bed which was a great upgrade from the standard sofa-bed. The Murphy bed was very comfortable. Both units were equipped with a kitchen with new appliances and had updated flat screen TV’s. Complimentary Wi-fi in the units and computers in the hotel lobby were available. Although air-conditioned, the AC units need to be balanced so as to have an even flow of comfortable air. We either got warm air or freezing cold air. This really wasn’t an issue for the time of year we were there but could be in the hotter summer months when the AC would be on for great length of time. Coin operated washers and dryers were located on each floor. Maid service is provided each day. In-room safes are located in each unit. A small maintenance issue in one of the bathrooms was dealt with very quickly. A heated outdoor pool is available to guests as is a fitness center. Complimentary parking is provided. Although there isn’t an on-site restaurant, a small Mini-Mart with snacks and personal items is available. However, the Carriage House is only a 5 minute walk to the Las Vegas Avenue with a wide variety of casinos, restaurants and shopping opportunities, as is The “Miracle Mile” in Planet Hollywood. It is also just across the Avenue from the New City Center development. The Las Vegas Trolley, which runs just behind of the Carriage House, is available either at the Bally’s/Paris or MGM stations for easy navigation up or down the Avenue. The Carriage House Deluxe Suite Hotel will certainly be considered on our next visit to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very Please”
Reviews.Author: highdesertbadger
Reviews.Content: I stayed here years ago and wondered how the property had stood up to time. I was pleasantly surprised. The management has done a very good job of keeping facilities here fresh and comfortable. As others have said, the location is great. Near the strip without the craziness of the bid hotel parking issues. My room was comfortable and everything worked fine. The pool was cool in February but the spa pool felt great. Parking is great and the internet connection worked wonderfully. My only disappointment is that when I stayed here in the past the Carriage House was by itself and now it is surrounded by huge high rise condominiums. Oh well. I got a great rate compared to the local "big box" hotels and felt it was money well spent. I will definitely stay here again on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in the center of the action”
Reviews.Author: sparkyy126
Reviews.Content: The Carriage House was perfect for what we were looking for. The room was clean with a full kitchen. The hotel is one block off the strip (5 min walk) to planet hollywood/cosmopolitan/Paris/Bellagio. The hotel is in such a location that it makes walking to every hotel on the strip (minus Circus Circus and Stratosphere) easy. The hotel was a 20$ cab ride to the airport which included our tip. The staff was friendly giving us directions to hoover dam/lake meade as well as restaurants on the strip. would definitely stay here again next time we are in vegas. you can save money by staying here while still being in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: Matt S
Reviews.Content: We we're quite surprised to find such a good hotel that close to the strip (~200 m from the heart of the strip) with such good rooms for so little money. The rooms are stylish, spaceous, and well equipped (even with kitchinette). Smell of smoke is ubiquitous in LV buildings, but was least disturbing in our room. All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, right size, right price”
Reviews.Author: TransplantedBuckeye
Reviews.Content: Just a block off the strip but quiet and relaxed. Small hotel with personnal service. Well maintained and clean. Not a glitzy Las Vegas experience but a pleasant change. Easy to get around and very walkable from the Luxar to the Mirage. The full kitchen was a nice touch fot those times you just need to stay in and get away from the crowds and noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great, affordable hotel just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: dense39
Reviews.Content: The hotel does not have a casino in it, but is just 5 minutes' walk to the nearest casino, so it's a great get-away from the noise of the slot machines, without being inconvenient. Miracle Mile is just across the road. The room was nice, with a kitchen in it, which was great. Internet was free. Staff were friendly. Overall, a nice, affordable hotel right off the strip, that I would recommend and will definitely be staying in again.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 10Lynn
Reviews.Content: 5 min walk to the strip and if you like quiet, simple environment, this is the hotel. Wifi in the room may not get connected sometimes. Some rooms might not be strip view.

Reviews.Title: “It's like an apartment right off the strip!”
Reviews.Author: whitpee
Reviews.Content: We arrived a few hours early and were able to get checked in right away. We asked for a renovated room, and for just $20 more, they gave us a larger room. The room was large with a full kitchen, full sized frig, oven, dish washer, microwave, pots, pans, silverwear, large couch, nice firm bed, etc.etc. etc!!! Price was GREAT! The room was big! Our friends had a place at the Cosmopolitan that was a closet compared to the size our room. :) I loved how you don't have to walk a mile through a casino just to get to your room. You enter the lobby, and boom, there is the elevator! The strip is just a short walk, and you enter at the best part of the strip. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Timeshare not hotel.....but good place”
Reviews.Author: glennil
Reviews.Content: Clean property close to the Vegas Strip. Nice having a mini kitchen to just eat a bowl of cereal when we wanted. Didn't meet a bad employee. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - what a find!”
Reviews.Author: ElGales
Reviews.Content: After reading the tripadvisor reviews, we requested a newly rennovated room and got one. On arrival at the hotel, the receptionist was very helpful, giving us maps to the strip, downtown and the bus routes, wifi codes for the three devices we had - nothing seemed too much trouble. The room was very tastefully decorated and a very comfortable environment. More than that, the hotel is fantastically located just opposite the Planet Hollywood resort. Given the price we paid for this hotel, the quality and location were superb and we would definitely seek to go to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, quiet location near heart of strip”
Reviews.Author: Buttsman
Reviews.Content: We traded a timeshare and stayed at the Carriage House based upon the numerous good reviews on Tripadvisor. We were definitely pleased with this decision. Our room was large, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was small while the kitchen was overly large (I would've changed this in the design) but otherwise it was a great place to spend a week in Vegas. The staff was friendly and helpful at all times The location is fantastic. Easy walk to the heart of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Who needs to be on the Strip?!”
Reviews.Author: lilorchid82
Reviews.Content: Not me. I can't believe that I haven't reviewed this hotel. This recent trip is my second time staying here. The first time I stayed here, they gave me a loft type set up where the bed was separated from the kitchen by a seating area. This time, they gave me a larger corner unit where the bedroom has its own door and is completely separated from the kitchen. The unit was clean and spacious...I can't think of any complaints except for the fact that the wifi was slow. I was on the 7th floor, though. The hotel does have nice amenities: like a market area downstairs (convenient if you don't want to walk to CVS or Walgreens), a gym (though limited b/c there are only a few machines), a whirlpool, swimming pool, and tennis court (I did not try these out). There was also a computer area downstairs where you can print out your boarding pass for free. Anyways, I think Carriage House's best attribute is its location. It's less than a block from Las Vegas Blvd, the Strip. I've never stayed at one of the Strip Casino hotels, but being the type of traveller I am, The Carriage House is enough for me. O, a few more things: the kitchen has a toaster and coffee maker...also full sized fridge, 2 burner stovetop, and dishwasher...no oven....salt and pepper are provided. Toiletries include crest toothpaste and bath and body work shampoo, conditioner, and soap.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and convenience near the hot part of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Reddy45
Reviews.Content: I'm inclined to think that someone looking for reviews of Carriage House pretty much knows what he or she wants while visiting Las Vegas. I mean, come on, you have the entire LV strip to choose from, full of hotel rooms that range from Circus Circus to Mandarin Oriental. Yet, you keep coming back. You weigh the price with the amenities, you think about the dreaded parking at mega resorts, the atrocious resort fees, and the long walks back to your hotel room. Perhaps you're a seasoned Vegas visitor, or it may be your first time and you're smart enough to get the most from your dollar. Regardless of your situation, the Carriage House serves the needs of smart travelers. Snuggled in a small lot between the Signature MGM Grand and the Marriott Grand Chateau on Harmon Blvd. east of the strip, the Carriage House is a diamond in the rough. It doesn't look like much from the outside, and you'll probably miss the entrance the first time you visit, but a similarly equipped room at any CET or MGM property would easily cost three times as much. You can read the other reviews to find out about the details. I like to list the pros/cons that others miss. Pros: - At check-in, you are given the option to disable pay-per-view billing. Seriously, how common sense is this? This is the first time I've actually seen a hotel give you the option to SAVE money. - I was given an entry into a $50 drawing when I checked in. I didn't win, but if I did it would have been nice. - The WiFi is FREE and is FAST (youtube friendly). (but, see below) Cons: - No deadbolt on the door. This isn't a huge deal since the hotel is very secure, but I'm just so used to it that I tend to ding any hotel that doesn't have these. - The WiFI, while fast, also employs a really absurd content firewall. I'm an avid target shooter and frequent various forums about such, and these sites were all blocked the day after I visited them on the Carriage House WiFI. - The room's AC/Heating system is central (not a unit mounted in the outside wall), but is quite loud. The reason this is an issue is, if you're watching television, you'll naturally want to turn up the volume. Since you are in a hotel with rooms that share walls, this tends to cause a chain reaction of noise complaints and whatnot. Overall, this is a great choice for the self-reliant, money-saving traveler. I have always been curious about this hotel and I'm pleased to say it has met most all of my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MaraD1025
Reviews.Content: First time staying at this hotel. Stayed 3 nights in January. The staff is very pleasant and helpful. I was worried about this hotel also being a time share, but the concierge (time share rep) was very helpful and not too pushy about going to the time share presentation. The hotel is in a great location. Close enough to the strip to where it’s an easy walk, but fare enough to where it’s very quiet. The room was very nice. Large room with a dining table, sofa bed, large flat screen in the front room and a separate large bedroom room with a king size bed, walk-in closet, separate vanity and sink, a safe to place your valuables. I would defiantly stay here again. The only dowside I found was that the internet connection was very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Travller3197
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carrage House for three weeks in November in a one bedroom suite. It was clean well maintained and affordable. The Carrage House in in a great location just off the strip/ The staff were knowledgable, friendly and always helpfull. The room was well appointed with a large flat panel TV, dining table, kitchenette large fridge, stove and microwave. If I had one complaint, it would be the wireless internet. It was sometimes difficult to access and on one or two occasions not available. This was our third visit to the Carrage House and we will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, quiet off strip stay.”
Reviews.Author: SBurnsey
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews pretty much capture everything about the Carriage House. We stayed 2 nights over Christmas and found the rooms to be spacious & quiet. Parking is right outside the door and a few steps to a waiting elevator to your floor. Our room had comfortable queen bed and 32" flat panel TV. Large bath off bedroom with access from main living area and bedroom. Main living area had sleeper sofa and another 32" flat panel TV. Son found sofa bed to be plenty comfortable. Large kitchen table shared this large living area. Roomy kitchen with frig, stove, oven, micro, dishwasher & coffee pot. Small assortment of pans and dishes too. Furnishings might be considered dated by Las Vegas standards, but room was very clean and showed little to no wear. I've stayed in Hiltons recently that were more dated than this. Hotel is short walk to Planet Hollywood Casino and the Miracle Mile shops that accompany it. The new City Center complex is another short walk away. Soon to be opening on corner in front of Planet Hollywood will be a rather large 24 hr Walgreens for stocking up on supplies. Internet service was fast, easy to use and included in price of stay. No resort fee. Others have mentioned deposit. I paid for stay up front and did not have any hold on VISA card. Front desk was more that helpful on check in and follow up questions my family had. We will gladly stay at the Carriage House anytime we are in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Emma071
Reviews.Content: So glad we stayed here. The room was perfect, very spacious and had a great modern kitchen, very large shower and a view out of the windows toward the strip. Perfect location in the middle of the strip and opposite miracle mile shops. Would recommend for anyone to stay here. Very very reasonable - great value!!

Reviews.Title: “Great property, iffy front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: khardst
Reviews.Content: This property is the place to stay when in Las Vegas. The rooms are very clean and the beds sleep great. The rooms are comfortable and have a home like feeling to them. The property does not offer any gambling, but does have a pool, jacuzzi, and excercise facility. The location of the hotel is just off the strip; not far at all, but definitely far enough to not be disturbed by all the noise. When booking the rooms, we had no problem, but when we arrived at the hotel it was a nightmare. We had several family members coming into town to stay at carriage house because this was a big family vacation. One family member made all the reservations so when we got there, the front desk staff would not let anyone check into their room (even though we had confirmation numbers) because the 1 family member that made reservations for the other 20 family members was not there. The other thing to know when staying here is that while most hotels hold or require a deposit of $50 to $100 for incidentals, The Carriage House requires $200, which is almost unheard of.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: janeks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carraige House and thouroughly enjoyed the experience, Bathroom was a good size with an enormous shower area but a small bathroom area. Rooms were a bit shabby but very clean and the service of all staff was superb. Being able to buy milk and bread on the premises was a plus although there was a Walgreens near the Market place which we used. A plus was that we were not pressurised by time share sales people Would certainly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet condo near strip”
Reviews.Author: wpwilie
Reviews.Content: We have been going there for many years. Plenty of parking. They have a nice grilling area if you want to throw a couple of steaks on the grill. Ask for one of the recently remodeled rooms. Being frequent visitors (one to two times a year) we are over the high end casino restaurants. One tip is to get hip on the happy hour deals. A lot of the high end steak houses have half price apps 4 to 6 pm plus a drink special or two. If you have a car Blue Martini has the best happy hour in Vegas. Located south on las vegas blvd in Town Square the drinks and apps are half price. The seared ahi tuna is only $9. If you don't gamble vegas is very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Closeness...”
Reviews.Author: jsaul
Reviews.Content: Closeness...my favorite thing about this hotel. Parking lot close to hotel entry. No need to walk 5-10 minutes through a hotel/casino, then find the car in a "Seinfeld" like gargantuan garage. No valet to call, then tip. Rooms close to elevator & entry. The time from leaving your room to leaving the hotel is no longer than 3-5 minutes. No long winding corridors. Hotel close to the Strip. We always walked to & from the Strip. Took no longer than 5-10 minutes to walk to Crystal Shopping Center, Aria, Cosmopolitan, etc. Our room had a nice view of the MGM Signature Towers & pools, & the Spring Mountains. While the rooms are clean & adequate, the decor is moderate budget hotel. The kitchen was a necessity since I do not like to eat in restaurants 2-3 times daily. The kitchen made up for the small workout room & the small pool being closed for winter. There was free WIFI & a business center for printing. Service was a little inconsistent. Some staff people were friendlier than others. We were never contacted by time share people. While I did not use their services, I noticed many people using Concierge service to arrange tours, shows, etc. The only negative I remember were loud conversations in the hallway around 7am. They occurred almost every morning. Sometimes it seemed to be the neighbors, other times the maintenance/cleaning staff. Either way it was annoying since I generally awake around 8am. The hotel does not have a casino. On the top floor a former restaurant space is now vacant. Due to the good location, kitchen, & reasonable rates I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Basic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MzMeliz
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel using a timeshare certificate we purchased. No complaints about the value. The room was average - dated and worn, slightly more spacious than a regular king room with a very small bathroom. It was quite, clean and comfortable. We only used it as a "home base" to sleep. We weren't approached by the timeshare sales other than a message on the phone inviting us to a meeting. If you are looking for a place to stay off of the strip and still be close to the hustle and bustle, then I recommend it. Short walk to the Miracle Mile shops in Planet Hollywood. We had breakfast and lunch at several places in the mall and it was quite convenient and not over-priced at all. It is also close to City Center. We took a recommendation from another reviewer and went to Ellis Island. We drove because it was cold in Vegas last week but it would be a short walk - right behind - Planet Hollywood. The ribs were fantastic and so was the beer that they brew on site. That's all they served though - BBQ chicken and ribs. Not hard to choose!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Solid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pick6king
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on an October visit. The location is very good. In New York-speak, it's about 2 short blocks (or less than 1 long block) off the strip. This turns out to be a great spot because it's close enough to walk anywhere, but far enough off the strip that noise isn't a problem. Great for sleeping in after long nights. Internet worked fine. Staff was courteous. Check-in was quick and efficient. Room was clean and relatively large. Seems to me that they wasted a little space with the dead space in the kitchen, but still, it was plenty of roomy enough. We slept in the single BR while a friend used the pullout in the living room area. Bathroom counters pace was skimpy. Some people used the pool, but we didn't visit. Looked fine but unspectacular from our room. One complaint..... we were in a non-smoking room, but the elevator and hallways (even on our floor) smelled extremely smoky. However, there was no trace in our room. Definitely a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: Tucks1956
Reviews.Content: Great hotel 'off strip'. Just down a side street off the strip (Harmon Avenue) and close to Planet Hollywood and the Miracle Mile shops so very easy to walk through the mall and access the strip. The room was of a decent size with a sitting area and kitchenette. Our room was situated at the rear of the hotel and we could see the monorail from our window. I was concerned that this may be noisy as I'm a light sleeper but it didn't disturb me once. The staff were all very friendly and helpful - very efficient check in and check out. Lift to all floors is accessed by your room key card so building felt very secure. There is an area in reception where they sell basic provisions which is very useful especially if you arrive late and don't want to go shopping for provisions. This hotel will not be for you if you want all the glitz, crowds, noise etc from a casino hotel, but if you want to get back to somewhere that is all peace and quiet, then I whole heartedly recommend that you stay at the Carriage House. My only negative is that the aircon unit which is located in a large cupboard in the room was on the noisy side when we switched it on (other reviewers have mentioned this). This was not really a problem for us as we stayed in November, but could be if it was in the height of the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable on the strip”
Reviews.Author: SMikeCarl
Reviews.Content: This timeshare complex sits a couple of blocks east of Las Vegas Blvd between Planet Hollywood & the MGM casino resort. A sort walk to the MGM gets you on the monorail & the entire strip from there. The rooms are not glitzy, but the 1 bedrooms are comfortable and the 2 bedrooms are essentially small condos. A bit light on amenities, but your only steps away from the Miracle Mile shops and the Las Vegas Strip. If you're staying more than a couple of days and aren't being comped rooms in a casino/resort, this is a great place to stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: marsworth75
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Carriage House. This hotel suited us perfectly. It's just off the "strip" but convenient to almost anything you wanted to get to. The hotel itself is quiet and unassuming. If you're looking for the glitz and glamour of a casino hotel then the Carriage House is not what you are looking for. If you're wanting a friendly, clean, safe and welcoming hotel then you will feel at home. The hotel is a block and a half from the strip just across from the Planet Hollywood and the Miracle Mile shopping mall. Plenty of parking, security a night time, although it was never an issue, friendly staff and a clean room. The Carriage House fit the bill perfectly for us.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel to stay in”
Reviews.Author: paul m
Reviews.Content: stayed here in november it was quite yet just of the main strip but close to the magic mile and ph west gate tower where you can shop or enjoy a drink and a meal i would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for all the action of the strip but the piece and quite at nite paul from devon

Reviews.Title: “Wireless is terrible”
Reviews.Author: MikePeggy
Reviews.Content: If you want to see a You-Tube video, or watch a streaming video or movie, the wireless here is TERRIBLE

Reviews.Title: “By Far the Best Value! Quiet, Roomy, Save on Meals!”
Reviews.Author: Kilika-FL
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Vegas ONLY to gamble, then, no, this is not the place for you. However, if you are going to do other things - see the Grand Canyon, Visit Valley of Fire, Red Rock or Mount Charleston, do a helicopter tour, stroll along Fremont Street, shop any of the huge malls, see a show, take the kids to a fascinating museums or fun theme park, AND, you need or want to do it on a reasonable budget, then this place absolutely CANNOT be beat! We paid $100/night for what is basically an apartment, albeit with an open plan. It has a full kitchen (with full-size 'fridge, oven, microwave, dishwasher, dishes, pots 'n pans, flatware, etc.), bathroom with shower (a bit on the small size, but we don't tend to spend a lot of time in the bathroom), and nice-sized living room that opens to the bedroom (there are vertical blinds that can be opened or closed between the living room and bedroom). Laundry rooms made packing lighter, too, since we could wash what we needed to. We drove to the Grand Canyon for our first three days (although we could have spent a week there!), then came back to Las Vegas for five more days at the Carriage House. We made a stop at a grocery store (after making a list before we left home, and bringing some things that are normally bought in large quantities - like a couple jars of spices, laundry detergent in a ZipLoc bag, sheets of fabric softener, etc.). Being able to store and cook cereal, snacks, milk, cheese, fruit, and even frozen meals (MUCH cheaper than eating out all the time!), was really nice... especially nice when you want a snack at 11pm while watching a movie (hot popcorn and a soda or glass of cold wine is great!) We were on the top floor and had a view facing west - toward Las Vegas Boulevard. Planet Hollywood (with it's immense Miracle Mile shops - spend the day there!) was directly across the street from us (on the north side), and the Harley Davidson Cafe was just two blocks down the street from us, right on LV Blvd. Bellagio and it's surreal fountains was a quick ten minute walk, as were Paris, Bally's, the new Cosmopolitan, Excalibur, Luxor, MGM and the Flamingo. All this, and the staff at The Carriage House was the best we've ever experienced (and we have traveled a LOT). They are accommodating, helpful, cheerful, and did an excellent job cleaning our room every day. The Carriage House MADE our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: luci5
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed at the Carriage House twice. Once at the end of April for 3 nights and again 10 days later for 3 nights. We have now stayed there 6 times. We were allocated Room 419 which was to the left as we came out of the elevator and not right as we always have been before. It was a one bedroom king suite, but this one had a full kitchen with oven and full bathroom with a bath. The bed wasn’t king sized, but queen. Doesn’t bother us, but I could see some people complaining. Turned out it was a handicapped room. The lounge/dining room was huge with a 3 piece suite, coffee table, 32”flat screen TV and a dining table for 4. The kitchen had a fridge freezer, oven and hob, microwave, 12 cup coffee maker, toaster and kettle. Loads of cupboard space. The bedroom was the same size as Room 505 with a 32” TV in the armoire which had 3 drawers below. The wardrobe was small, but there was a huge closet in the lounge which housed the safe. The bathroom was the biggest we’ve had at the CH with a bath with shower over, sink with a good sized countertop and toilet. There was a door into the lounge and a sliding door into the bedroom. We had a good view of the tennis courts and pool and could see the MGM, THE Hotel, NYNY, Mandarin Oriental, Cosmopolitan, Eiffel Tower, PH and PH Towers. We love the Carriage House and have stayed there 6 times so far and have 2 more stays booked for next year. It is small and friendly and so different from other hotels in Vegas. It is a quiet sanctuary away from the noise and madness of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Sophie35
Reviews.Content: Although not on the strip, this hotel is located just around the corner. Its excellent location allows you to be on the strip in a matter of minutes, while still enjoying quiet nights. The rooms were very comfortable and excellent value for your money. The bed was among the best I ever experienced! The room felt spacious, clean and cosy. There's free coffee, tea and wifi. The bathroom was clean and comfortable, the towels soft and thick, and the soap smelled wonderful :-) The hotel staff was very friendly. Although we accidentally made a reservation for the wrong day, they did not make a problem of it and provided us with a beautiful room anyway. All in all an excellent choice for accomodation in Vegas! It's a pitty we couldn't stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Halloween in Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: nkdsurfer
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms here over Halloween weekend. The rooms were spacious and clean. One of our rooms was upgraded to a 2-bedroom suite which was a huge plus! We love the location. Just short walk about a block and you can access the "mericle mile of shops" at the Planet Hollywood. We went to the Marquee at the Cosmopolitan which we aere able to walk to :) We have stayed here a few times before and we will be back again hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jackie0705
Reviews.Content: We have recently returnred from Las Vegas where we stayed for a week at the Carriage House. It is in a fantastic location one block back from the strip. The Miracle Mile shops of Planet Holllywood are just accross the road, and it is also very close to the new City Centre. We only had a studio apartment but it was very nice and clean. There are Laundry facilities on most of the floors. We found a place called Ellis Island which is about a 10 minute walk (one block back) from the Carriage House where the food and drink prices are considerably less than on the strip. This was clearly where most of the locals go and is well worth a visit. We would definately recommend the carriage house, and would like to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “location, location location”
Reviews.Author: cat0313
Reviews.Content: we bought into the Carriage House in 1995. It suited our family perfectly, MGM Theme park behind us, now gone and when staying on the other side the view of the strip, now more to see. But we still enjoy staying at the Carriage House. Since the purchase in 1995 so many improvements have been done, security to go up stairs and guards on duty, always feel so safe. There's a little store in the lobby, little pricey but hey convenient. The rooms are clean and well stocked, a safe in the room is nice to have. The pools isn't really big and glitzy, but both of my kids learned how to swim, is just perfect for relaxation. Perfect location for the strip, felt safe walking at midnight. Far enough, but just close enough too. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely Small Resort, Studio Rooms On The Small Side”
Reviews.Author: Laineybop
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 2 week stay (Oct 2011) at the Carriage House and here is a summary of what we thought. -Staff communication via email before we arrived was fantastic, very helpful. -Stayed in a Studio apartment on the seventh floor overlooking the pool, which was a first for us, we usually stay in a minimum of a one bed wherever we go. -Found studio apartment to be too small with no privacy. Person standing in doorway can see the whole room including the bed and if you are not properly attired you have nowhere to hide. -Realised after a short while that not much natural light coming from the one window, had to have lights on during the day time. -The bathroom was very small with a shower that you had to lean back under in order to wash hair, and I'm only 5'3" and don't know how my husband managed! Once sat on the loo, you can't shut the bathroom door as there is not enough room, so remember to shut it when you first go in! -The air conditioning unit was so noisy every time it kicked in, that if we were asleep it woke us up with a start. It doesn't help that the ac unit is in a locked cupboard in the small studio. We asked for it to be checked in case there was something wrong with it. We don't know if it was checked, but we did request and receive a plug in box fan to at least move the air in the room. The window only opened about 6 inches but we understand that is for safety reasons. -The kitchenette area was perfectly adequate, although a freezer would have been nice. Plenty of crockery and cutlery enough for 4 people. -The bed was firm and we both slept really well on it. The pillows were a bit high for me, but I found undoing the zip on the protector cover under the pillowcase released a bit of a vacuum - strange I know but it worked for me! -Housekeeping was really good and came in to make bed and empty rubbish, change towels if needed on a daily basis. They even did our dishes for us a couple of times, (there is no dishwasher) which they are not supposed to do. -A washing machine and tumble dryer are located on each floor, costing $1.50 and $1.00 respectively. Single dose Tide for the washing machine available in reception for $1 and 2 Bounce sheets for $1 -We loved the swimming pool and especially the hot tub, both of which we used after dark, it was a shame it closed at 10pm as there were a number of times we could have really done with the hot tub after a long day. -Check in and check out was a breeze. We didn’t use the concierge or go for the usual timeshare meet and greet, and there was no pressure, which was lovely. -Everyone we met at the resort, employee or visitor was very pleasant. We had a no smoking room, but there was a nice clean smoking area on the back patio with table and chairs, which is where we met and chatted with some really friendly people. -If you want to spend some time away from the strip the following are all great places to visit, and can be done in day, some may be a long day, but worth it! Death Valley National Park, Red Rock Canyon, Mount Charleston, Hoover Dam, Zion National Park, Little A'Le'Inn Rachel NV, Area 51 Hope you find this review useful, and enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet retreat close to The Strip”
Reviews.Author: SkwerlyOne
Reviews.Content: If you don't care about staying in a smokey gambling casino, then this is the place for you. It's 2 blocks off Las Vegas Blvd. Central Strip area... a 5-7 minute walk to the MGM Grand & also super close to Miracle Mile shops, Planet Hollywood, Bellagio, Cosmopolitan, etc. The hotel itself offers free wi-fi & free computers (2 of them), so you can print boarding passes. There's a pool, Jacuzzi, tennis court, & ample parking. We didn't have a car, so not sure if there's a charge for parking, but I don't think so. We got the AAA rate ($109 Fri.-Sat./$99 Sun.-Thurs.). A very good deal. We had a suite, which was actually 2 adjoining rooms, each with its own kitchen & bathroom. Room amenities were nice, with in-room safes & kitchen or kitchenette. One of our rooms had a full kitchen (stove, microwave, full-size frig & dishwasher), bar stools, dining table, love seat, & wall bed. Our other room had a kitchenette (smaller frig & no dishwasher), dining table, no love seat or bar stools, but a king bed. The wall bed was super comfortable, but I suppose some people wouldn't like it. Plus, it did block the loveseat when it was down. I will definitely stay here whenever I go to Vegas. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: LindaH72
Reviews.Content: We're paying $110 incl tax for a King Suite. The hotel only does suites, which are huge! Very good value given it's close location to The Strip, and size of the rooms. Would thoroughly recommended staying here if you're after somewhere to sleep, without all the normal Vegas extras e.g. Casino etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: JeniB186463
Reviews.Content: This is a non-gaming hotel just off The Strip and was excellent value for money. Huge bed was very comfortable. Bath with a shower over, separate wash basin was spotless, shampoo, conditioner, soap and body lotion replenished daily. Even cotton buds, cotton wool, tissues and toothpaste were supplied. Rooms cleaned every day if you wish. Adequately stocked kitchenette, filter coffee, tea replenished every day. Very good quality furnishings. This is a time-share hotel and we were invited to a meeting about this, which we did not attend, however we were under no pressure to do so. The only negative was that the air con was rather noisy, but we didn't really need to use it much. Overall a lovely to place to stay, and only 4 minute walk to The Strip. Just remember to tip the room attendants daily!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, economy hotel, but no glitz and beware the timeshare salesperson”
Reviews.Author: Lorenzo50
Reviews.Content: We received a great rate at this hotel and I was especially excited about the advertised spacious rooms. In total we rented 3 rooms, one bedroom suite and two deluxe rooms. The one bedroom deluxe is worth the 20 a night more, so go for that one. My deluxe room was spacious, but the furniture in my one bedroom deluxe was sad and dated from the 80s (which I can't understand, since the hotel is not that old) and not at all like the pictures on their internet sites. There was an uncomfortable smell in the room, an odor of stale cooking, which is unfortunately a problem when you stay in a hotel where guests are cooking in their rooms. The small kitchenette was nice, but not very functional. I guess someone could use the stove and oven, if you needed to, but it is not very practical. The hotel staff at the front desk and housekeeping were very friendly. However, they keep trying to sell you timeshares while you are there. When we checked in, they asked us if we wanted to attend a timeshare meeting in the morning for free tickets to a show. We all said no, but they called us again at 9:00 the next morning (it is Vegas after all and we were still in bed) to try to get us to attend the timeshare presentation. I didn't ask for a 9:00 wake up call. The location is not too bad about 1 1/2 blocks from Planet Hollywood, the closest casino, which is where is spent most of our time. I paid $59 for my room, which is great for the location. All in all, not a bad place to stay if this is your first time to Vegas or if you are a non-gambler. However, there are other hotels that offer suites (Rio, Tuscany Suites) that are just as nice (or nicer) and cheaper if you drop some money in their casino. Since I gambled at both while I was there, I am already getting e-mail offers for a free or $39 a night hotel room. I spent a small amount at the downtown hotels and I am also getting offers for free rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Value”
Reviews.Author: antsyfeet
Reviews.Content: Start with easy parking, friendly staff, and a quiet, clean, non-smoking, well-appointed room. Add a small kitchen, great shower, excellent bed and pillows, good-sized pool with hot tub (and pool towels!), and good security. It all comes to a great value. Honestly, we couldn't believe how good this hotel is for the price we paid. As for location, we're not big-city people, and after a week at Zion & Brice, we were glad to be a couple of blocks from the strip, where it was less hectic. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Home”
Reviews.Author: evenyl
Reviews.Content: When I reserved at the Carriage House by a timeshare exchange, I was a little dissapointed because I didn't know much about the hotel only that it was near the strip where i wanted to be. Over the last 10 years we have stayed at many places. So I was pleasently surprised when we checked in. There was ample free on-site parking, Just across the driveway was a pool and spa and fenced in tennis court. It was small enough with only 9 floors that the front desk remembers you. No casino or restaurants, but they are nearby. Our one bedroom was newly renevated with full kitchen(stainless steel and granite), GE appliances, dishwasher and all kitchen amenities, dining table, large living room and one of the mostcomfortable beds of any hotel. Daily maid service with generous amenities. Across the street was the Miracle Mile Shops with anything you might want - 170 stores, 15 restaurants, Planet Hollywood Casino,theatre shows and more. A short drive away we found Ellis Island Casino, Restaurant and Brewery where there were "cheap eats" ($5.29 bacon and eggs, $7.99 sirloin steak full dinner) The concierge desk was helpful in the non smoking hotel. When I needed maintenance because the TV wasn't working, he was there in 3 minutes. I didn't use it but there was free WiFi in the room and free internet in the lobby. This is really a "come again, welcome home " hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: A M
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the carriage house. We have to kids and while we did miss the experience of staying in one of the casino's it was good to get away from the strip. The kitchen facilities were excellent.We had our own breakfast everyday which saved up heaps of money. We had smartphones and used their WIFI which was more than adequate and they had internet computers down in the lobby with printers which was great. We had groceries delivered which was done on the internet down in the lobby. Overall it was a good experience and I recommend staying there, its one block away from the strip and close to planet Hollywood shops. ' Guaranteed non smoking was good too.

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: oneabbey
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3nights and could not fault it///kitchen facilitys in room, pool towels suppliied///just off the strip

Reviews.Title: “Quiet retreat in midst of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Joan C
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by this great hotel. We had just disembarked from a 3 day raft trip in the Grand Canyon and were anxious to get back to civilization. We were greeted by a friendly clerk and quickly given our keys. The hotel has superb security and the room we stayed in was great. It was very clean, spacious and quiet. The location could not be better. Close enough to the Strip to walk to almost every casino, yet far enough off the Strip to not be bothered by the noise and activity. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting great location without the noise and activity of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: helmac
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel specifically because it was not too high (we have a vertigo sufferer in our party) and as it does not have a casino we thought it would be a bit quieter than the hotels on the strip also it is ideally placed being a 5 minute safe walk from the strip. The hotel is spotlessly clean, has free internet access in the lobby and fresh coffee in the lounge. The staff are very friendly and helpful with good advice on places to eat and directions to various places that we wanted to visit. The room was really nicely appointed and fairly quiet and the beds were very comfortable I had the best sleep of our whole trip here. If I visit Vegas again I wouldn't even bother looking elsewhere this hotel is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: sydneylizzy_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here recently for 3 nights. Not wanting to stay in the big Casino atmosphere, we elected to stay just off the strip. It was probably the best decision we have ever made. This hotel is spotlessly clean, the room was spacious and well appointed and the staff are extremely professional, yet friendly and helpful. It is literally a five minute walk and you are on the strip. Would not stay anywhere else if we return to Las Vegas any time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and newly refurbished”
Reviews.Author: traveller175England
Reviews.Content: Travelling with my Wife and her Sister we needed somewhere with a seperate bedroom. The Cariage House fitted the bill as a timeshare exchange. We had room 913 on the top floor, we vwere the first guest following refurbishment,rooms were very nicely appointed. Small but nice pool area, a bit of traffic noise but only to be expected given the location. It is half a block from the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we stayed”
Reviews.Author: LotusHoney
Reviews.Content: At first we were reluctant to stay at a non-casino hotel in Vegas. We are so glad we chose The Carriage House. We were within walking distance to all the action, but also able to walk away from it. The Carriage House room we had was clean, spacious and quite comfortable. We liked having a fridge for water and late night snacks we brought with us. The staff was friendly and helpful. Parking was free and we always had a good spot. To get to The Strip, we crossed the street and cut through the Miracle Mile Shops and Planet Hollywood Casino. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Time”
Reviews.Author: 22exeter
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 days in september. On first impression we were concerned about the size of the pool, as the website image makes it look larger than it actually is but it was very warm, and the hot tub was lovely. The room was perfect, and very large with a massive bed, the kitchen had all of the amenities that we could wish for even a dish washer! Dispite no free wifi, there are computers in the reception area with wifi which are free to use. Dispite being off of the strip, it was only a 2 minute walk to the strip and the planet hollywood casino. The only negative I have was that the shower was fairly weak. Overall very impressed with this hotel, and would definatly return.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the madding crowd”
Reviews.Author: StokePotter
Reviews.Content: If you want a gaming hotel with lots of facilities, then this probably isn't the hotel for you. However if you want a quiet retreat to escape the madness of the Strip, then this is definitely for you. We had a very enjoyable stay at The Carriage House. It is very conveniently situated for the Strip and also close to the monorail (using the MGM stop). It is also close to the Miracle Mile shops at Planet Hollywood, where there are a few restaurants you could get breakfast. The room we stayed in had a mini kitchen, with a microwave and tea & coffee making facilities. The one downside is that although the rooms can sleep up to 4 people, if you wanted to eat anything in your room, there was only enough cutlery (silverware) etc for 2 people. It has about 110°F during the time we were there, but the air conditioning worked well. There is a pool across the car park, which, although was used quite a lot, never seemed to be overly busy. There is a small shop in reception and also a small gym and a business centre, with two PCs.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: taffydi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4nights, it's a lovely hotel a couple of minutes walk off the strip. It is quiet and clean. The rooms are spacious complete with a full kitchen and cleaned daily. The staff are helpful and knowledgable about the area. The pool is nice and clean with towels supplied, there isn't too much shade but the sun goes down behind the buildings early afternoon. The hotel doesn't have a casino but there are plenty in Vegas. The Miracle Mile shops are across the road. I strongly recommend an evening at the Fremont Street experience, the entertainment and atmosphere is fantastic and all for free.

Reviews.Title: “If in Las Vegas, this is a very nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: nanameyer
Reviews.Content: This was the last night of our 7 day Grand Canyon circle tour. Our room had one king size bed and the room was big. If we would have stayed longer than one night, it had a small kitchen area where you could make meals or keep your beverages cold. You had to use your room key to access the elevator, so we felt safe and it was quiet. They have two computers in the lobby, if you need to check in for your flight home. They also have free WiFi. It's about a 1/4 mile off the famous Las Vegas strip, just south of Planet Hollywood & north of MGM. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived around 11am, but we were given a vehicle permit, so we could park our car and walk the strip. They have a pool & hot tub which you have to use your room key to enter. Towels were provided by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JDM637
Reviews.Content: I had only planned 2 nights in Vegas, but added a third which we couldn't afford at the hotel we'd pre booked, so came here and for $60 a night it's wonderful. Lovely rooms with a full kitchen, nice staff, secure, and only a 2 minute walk to The Strip. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: Gill S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in August 2011. The hotel was well run, clean and with very helpful and friendly staff. It was lovely to be away from the busy strip and yet it is only a couple of minutes walk away to the main centre of the strip and the Bellagio etc. Miracle Mile shop (in Planet Hollywood) is just across the road.My teenagers enjoyed using the pool and it was never busy. We originally had a 2 doubles room with the kitchenette, but came home one day to find a plumbing problem caused by the builders who were refurbishing the next door room. The staff immediately came and cleaned up and moved us to another room. We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite with HUGE kitchen area. Shame we only had one night left to enjoy it! Only downside was my eldest teenager said the sofabed wasn't that comfy. I read all the reviews before booking this hotel and wanted to add my own as it was such a good find. If you don't want to stay in a hotel with a casino, I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I wanted”
Reviews.Author: bergeje
Reviews.Content: Quiet, large room with full kitchen equipment, near the Strip, parking for the car, WiFi for the iPad and finally a good swimming pool. And all that at bargain price. Definitely recommended if you are not a gambler.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy place near the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: BJMK
Reviews.Content: Excellent contemporary decor. Large clean rooms. Across the street from Planet Hollywood and Miracle Mile shops. Two blocks to the Strip and City Center. Great for those who want to be close to the glitter but not inundated by it 24/7. Excellent exercise room and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously needs a renovation.”
Reviews.Author: drdave007
Reviews.Content: Barely passable for decor. Carpets and walls neglected. Small pool. Disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Good room, at a good price just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: arad85
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a US road trip. The staff were friendly and efficient, the room good sized and pool lovely. The only letdown was that our room smelled of stale cigarettes - even though it was a no-smoking room. When asked, the front desk did put a machine in to remove the smell, but as we were only out for a short while, it didn't completely remove the smell, but did make it bearable. Requested they put it back in the room when we left early the next morning....

Reviews.Title: “love it here and will return”
Reviews.Author: josmatt
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th time at the Carriage House and we like the fact that it is just of the Strip so is very quiet with easy excess to all of the Strips entertainments Hotel staff friendly and very helpful with information on where to go and how to get there. Kitchen and rooms very clean so would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A Diamond in the desert.”
Reviews.Author: Janet_Percy
Reviews.Content: We didn't book and were lucky they had a room for us. When we got to the room we were very impressed to find it was a suite! Full kitchen facilities, lounge area, with a pull out double sofa bed, table and chair, and a very comfortable King size bed. Rates were very good compared to anything else on the strip. This is literally in the middle of it all, but just off the strip, so quieter and they had a pool! this was a blessing to cool down at the end of the day. Parking was included as well as free internet. All round excellent value and I highly recommend it. Staff were very helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “So good we are repeat customers...”
Reviews.Author: csweetmia
Reviews.Content: We found this through AAA many years ago...its a jewel. Across from Planet Hollywood..walking distance to the Strip, close to Ellis Island and Terrible's which have the best eating places in them. It's not a Casino and a very secure building. The staff are friendly and helpful. Clean rooms to accommodate a couple or a small group. Full kitchen features, internet.....Small store for snacks...We stay here every year now.

Reviews.Title: “Great value! We would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: ikapl
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the size of our room / suite -- it was enormous! The location was fabulous - just one block from the Strip and near the monorail. The staff aim to please and were very courteous and helpful. Absolutely no complaints -- we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: lkastens
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel off the noisy path of the Strip, but still close enough to walk. The room was large and clean with a mini furnished kitchen. I especially liked the shower and toilet were separate from the sink and vanity. It made getting ready in the morning with 2 others much easier. This will be our primary hotel when we visit from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Carriage House - A place to call home...”
Reviews.Author: triplea99
Reviews.Content: For my trip to Vegas I was looking for a non- gaming hotel and choosed the Carriage House. And it was the best choice I have ever made. A very quiet Hotel with a very comfortable and spacious Studio - newly renovated and in a design, like I would expect from the Cosmopolitan there in Vegas. Perfect service and friendly staff making this trip to the best. Also they have a nice pool and spa - so everything to make your trip to Vegas perfect. High speed internet for free (not like in the Polo Towers) Thanks to the Team there in Carriage House and hope I see you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Comfortable, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: mtnlvr81960
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for 3 nights and enjoyed our stay. This hotel is pretty quiet since it's not right on the strip, it's not huge and there is no casino. The walls are a little thin though but otherwise it was very quiet. The rooms include a kitchenette which was nice to have a coffee maker, refrigerator and microwave. It was clean and pretty comfortable. I liked the large closet and in-room safe also. They are currently renovating it so there is construction going on. We weren't in the room much during the day anyway so it wasn't much of a bother for us. The staff were all very nice and friendly also. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Walk to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: iowateach
Reviews.Content: Love this place! I first stayed here years ago, and I keep coming back. It's a timeshare resort that also has rooms available to the public. It's one long block to the Strip or just across the street from Planet Hollywood. It's quiet and has a small pool, hot tub, tennis court, and laundry available. Everything is within a few steps. I hate the big resorts where you have to walk forever. Rooms have kitchens. I usually eat out in Vegas but like coffee and breakfast in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: NikolayG
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel if you don't want the noisy crowds all around. The Carriage House is situated just around the corner from The Strip, in front of Planet Hollywood, and doesn't have its own casino. This makes it very convenient for getting (walking) everywhere along The Strip, and at the same time, much less noisy than The Strip hotels. The room was spacious and clean, and the staff was really friendly and helpful. The hotel also provides free WiFi Internet connection, which is also very nice. There are just two reasons for not giving 5 stars. First, there were renovation works all along the Harmon Avenue between the hotel and the Strip during my visit. And second, the room was adjacent to some machinery room which was producing a disturbing hum from time to time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, quiet and I will be back”
Reviews.Author: JLS777
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Carriage House Las Vegas in April 2011. I stayed in the room the first and last nights alone (until the rest of my family arrived). I felt very comfortable and safe doing so since a room key is required to ride the elevator. I am a Rooms Division Manager in a hotel so I am almost looking for something to be wrong or out of place. The only thing I can say is the TV was a little fuzzy in the bedroom. The room was LARGE (1 bedroom suite) it was clean, and comfortable and had a great view (a corner room). I loved the walk-in closet, xtra vanity in the bedroom and that you could access the bathroom from both the bedroom and living room. Items in the room like the notepad, pens, and bath amenities were organized by a perfectionist (like someone took great pride in making sure it was perfect for my arrival). The location was great, only half a block to walk to the strip. Then you can walk more or take the monorail or the double decker bus that makes several stops going all the way up to Fremont Street. I made use of the mini-mart for breakfast items and late-night snacking. I visited the pool only 1 day since we only had one 80 degree day, frankly it was cold and windy during our stay the first week in April. The front desk, housekeeping and maintenance staff that I encountered during my stay were smiling and friendly, eager to help or answer any question I had. My family stayed on another floor and also had a spacious room. There is a casino and a variety of restaurants right across the street from The Carriage House. I would recommend The Carriage House to anyone looking for a quiet, clean, secure hotel that is not too far from the Vegas strip. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis amid the meyhem”
Reviews.Author: Ofield
Reviews.Content: Great hotel just one block from the main strip being located between Planet Hollywood and the MGM. The Carriage House is an oasis in what is a "full on" experience in Las Vegas. Seeing the other huge hotel complexes we were delighted with our choice which suited our needs perfectly. The fact that the Carriage House has no casino/gambling area was a major plus for us. Our room was a suite with it's own kitchen which, for a family of 4, was excellent. Only difficulty having no transport was food. The hotel has a small store and the concierge notes advise that some shops will deliver though we did not use this service. There is also a 7/11 not too far away. Great pool and also has a small fitness area. Would benefit from offering some sort of meals but that would be the only reason for us not giving this hotel top marks. Very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay”
Reviews.Author: jancowan
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at the Carriage House did not disappoint. They are in the middle of upgrading the complex and various rooms are under renovation but we did not notice any noise. We did occupy one of the upgraded rooms and it was very comfortable for our five night stay. We did find the room service very slow, we returned on a couple of occations in the early afternoon and found that our room had not been cleaned. One distinct advantage that the Carriage House has over the other Gambling hotels is that you do not have to drag your cases through the casino to get to the check in and then wait in line. The check in and out process was very easy and quick. Once the exterior areas have been upgraded the work will not impact a stay, at the moment there is considerable dust from the removal of pavement etc., but that will soon be remedied. For the convenience of being so close to the strip, the price and convenience cannot be beat. There is free Wifi in your room plus no add ons for "resort fees".

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Roadtrippin_2011
Reviews.Content: Really really awesome hotel. Just of-strip and quiet. Clean, enough space, good matrass, great swimming pool. Friendly staff. Only thing that;s a shame is the fact they don't serve breakfast. But we really recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Solid, clean accomodation in central location”
Reviews.Author: TouristeSeattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Carriage House. The hotel is centrally located, just east of MGM Grand, and within walking distance (5 - 10 min) of the Las Vegas Monorail for easy access to all Strip sights. This was our third time at Carriage House - the hotel has been remodeled and upgraded extensively and we found our lodging excellent. -Carriage House is not a casino, so no slots or shows in the hotel -small grocery items including water, milk, snacks, cereals are available in the hotel lobby -our room was exceptionally clean, had a variety of Bath & Body works products, and nice linens/towels -we only used the refrigerator of the kitchenette, but there seemed to be plenty of dishes and silverware for simple meals -staff was exceptionally friendly -WiFi was excellent and throughout property -hotel is renovating the exterior including landscaping and entry to hotel was cumbersome; presumably this will be finished soon but it's good to get directions from hotel website to drive to the hotel for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “ACE PLACE !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Yackie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just off the strip,and quite.Opposite Plant Hollywood and the Magic Mile shopping ,MGM all within 4 minutes walk.The hotel is excellent with a small self contained kitchen. Great for doing breakfast before going out.Excellent pool area and is currently under going upgrades of the area around the outside. Walked thru a lot of the lobby areas of the name brand hotels, don't go there as the congestion and lines to check in or out were long.Not at the Carriage House,its a little boutique hotel with a personal atmosphere and no crowds. Would reccommend this place to everyone as is excellent. If you are going out to the Grand Canyon see Alicia at one of the Visitor Bureau locations on the strip,In A Camera Shop. She will have a Gold Flying Kangaroo Pin on and tell her Aussie Dave ( Who Gave her the Pin) said to say hello and she will cut you a good deal !!!! Try the $7 24 /hour open bus ticket ,good value and saves a lot of walking. Hop on Hop Off . Aussie Dave & Ann Marie

Reviews.Title: “Quiet place, close to the strip”
Reviews.Author: dkkmclark
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only a short walk away from the strip. It is very close to the Cosmopolitan, Planet Hollywood and the Miracle Mile shopping plaza. I had a conference at the Cosmo and stayed here since it was just half the cost. The staff at check in were courteous, but not overly friendly. Our room was average, clean. The swimming pool/tennis court areas are not directly attached to the hotel. One has to walk outside, across the entrance drive, then use a room key to enter the gated areas. The hotel is currently undergoing construction. The only ice machine I could find was located on the top floor. No one appeared to be staying on this floor, the area was very old with low ceilings and somewhat creepy. There was plenty of parking which made it very nice to come and go as needed. On Sunday morning, they offered a very informative session discussing the do's and don'ts of Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable value”
Reviews.Author: UKexpatNewYork
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to be staying a second night in Barstow (had in fact paid in advance for the hotel), but felt the 'urge' to spend a night in Vegas before flying on to our next destination. We found the CH on Tripadvisor, they had availability at the bargain price of $119 for a king room so we booked, not expecting much to be honest. There was a little delay on check-in while they located a room that was ready for occupation, but when we got to the 8th floor we found we'd been upgraded to a corner suite. The room was huge, with a small well-equipped fitted kitchen, a comfortable sitting room large bedroom, bathroom, dressing area and walk-in closet. The decor was very tasteful, in muted earth shades, and everything was of a high quality. The wifi was also very fast, much faster than in a lot of hotels, although you have to call down to reception for your own personal password which only works on one device, all of which was a bit of hassle. We were worried about noise because the hotel is so close to the Strip, but it was very quiet and we slept very well. We will almost certainly stay here again if we revisit Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great, managed very well”
Reviews.Author: khenaro
Reviews.Content: It was perfect: nicely decorated rooms, clean, fully equipped including safe (you'd hardly like to keep your documents with your in Vegas). Even small kitchen area with everything needed was in the room. I also liked the service very much: we’ve asked for non-smoking room and got it with no sign of smoking smell anywhere; we've asked for later check-out and we had it free-of-charge. We've asked whether we could leave the car at the parking after check-out and we were easily permitted to do that. I had a feeling that ladies ruling the service in this hotel really wanted us to feel comfortable, not just followed instructions. Location: 3 mins walk from strip. Convenient for those would like to feel Vegas but not be overwhelmed by it. As there is always some construction in Vegas, the view from the room was for a couple of caterpillar machines. But, to be honest, who cares about the view when you have Bellagio in 10 minutes walk?

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: allanfromm
Reviews.Content: Directly across the street from Planet Hollywood complex and a couple of Marriott Hotels and just around the corner from Bellagio and Caesar's Palace - at only half the cost or less - and nice and quiet. No gambling or slot machines in the hotel. Rooms are spotless with a nice kitchen area. They have done everything I can think of to ensure security - room card required to operate elevator and security guard or Conceirge at desk in entry lobby around the clock. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good condition and very good mid-strip location.”
Reviews.Author: Neuron
Reviews.Content: SUMMARY – The Carriage House (TCH) is in good condition and easy walking distance to the best area of the strip. Disappointments include the absence of balconies, and the absence of a radio or iPod dock in the living room area. I would stay at THC again, but my first choice in timeshare rentals would be a low-rise property with a balcony near the strip. Overview - I stayed at TCH in March 2011 for 10 nights. This property has a nine story building with a lobby, two room-key-secured fast elevators, a tennis court and a pool. TCH was booked as an RCI timeshare rental. I used a Laundromat, not the laundry room available on each TCH floor. Heavy construction on the east and north parking lot area did not affect my stay. On site there is no restaurant and no gambling. I had a rental car and free parking was always available. I last stayed at TCH in 2005 and have stayed at 5 other Las Vegas timeshare rental properties. Pro FRONT DESK – The staff was competent and friendly, and internet savvy. No checkout surprises. LOCATION - 5 minute walk to the best part of strip. The nearest casinos and shopping were City Center (Aria and Cosmopolitan), MGM Grand, and Planet Hollywood. ROOM – Everything was in good condition. My 8th floor no-smoking one bedroom corner unit was big, almost too big. Bathroom with tub and shower. Dressing area with sink, walk in closet, iron and ironing board, and free safe. Bedroom had king bed with lots of pillows. Three windows in the bedroom. One window in the living room. Dining room table and 4 chairs. Telephone. KITCHEN - Full refrigerator, sink, dishwasher, toaster, no ice maker. Microwave and stove top with no oven. Coffee maker. CLEAN – daily maid service, if you want it. TECHNOLOGY - Flat TV in the living room and bedroom. The living room TV had composite video input. In-room free, unsecured, login required, wireless G with good performance (all rooms had wired DSL in 2005). Each WIFI device needs a login ID. The bedroom had a clock radio with iPod dock tethered to the wall. There was a DVD VCR in the living room that I did not use. The lobby had two free internet terminals and a color printer that worked. HVAC – The AC, heat and thermostat worked. Con NO BALCONY – Unfortunately, even some of the new timeshare properties in Vegas don’t have balconies. The windows could be opened a crack, but otherwise you are in a box with windows. NO LIVING ROOM RADIO – I wish the tethered radio iPod dock in the bedroom could have been moved to the living room. TECHNOLOGY – The two flat screen TVs displayed analog low-def TV and often at the wrong aspect ratio. DIM LIGHTING – Lighting (except kitchen) was dim incandescent bulbs. I should have replaced them with bright bulbs.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: georgiaapple
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night. Room clean and quit. Staff friendly. Felt safe. 2 minor issue one with key card which was corrected. The other with the light in the bathroom. Free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for the price!”
Reviews.Author: spicyindulgence
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in May 2011. The location was just a short walk away from the Strip, just diagonally across Planet Hollywood, which makes it very convenient. For my simple family of 4, we found the rooms tastefully decorated, bedsheets were clean, bath and shower facilities were great! Staff at the hotel were helpful and attentive, always all smiles. They helped us got tickets to The Lion King efficiently. The lady at the counter even gave us very detailed directions to the musical's location. Very patient indeed! It has definitely been a pleasant stay and made our first trip to Vegas a really nice one!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Your Stay”
Reviews.Author: DTG86
Reviews.Content: Located right off the strip, this is a nice hotel. Very clean and comfortable. Depending on what you are in Vegas for its the best bang for the buck. I recommend this hotel if you want privacy and quiet. But if you want the party scene this place is not for you. This hotel was filled with older people who wanted peace and quiet. The staff is very friendly and helpful and even gave our group tickets to a comedy show which was amazing. Overall great stay, and depending on what I am in Vegas for, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet yet convenient to the strip”
Reviews.Author: PokeyPaddler
Reviews.Content: This hotelis just a few stories high, and is sandwiched between the strip and the Signature buildings of the MGM Grand. It is one block closer to the strip than the Signature. The location is good if you prefer to be a bit away from the busy crowds on the strip, yet close enough to walk there whenever you please. Blissfullly, there is no casino, therefore it is quiet and completely non smoking. We had a one bedroom unit, in case a family member would visit. There are two different floor plans for the one bedrooms. We chose the one with the bathroom easily accessible from either the living room, with pull down murphy bed, or the bedroom with king bed. This unit had a small kitchen area and a small living room-everything rather tight, but adequate. The larger one bedroom, with larger kitchen and dining area, and larger living room has a bathroom with a snazzy stall shower; the bathroom is right off the entry foyer. The units are decorated simply ; some are in need of updating, but everything was in working order and the bed was comfortable. The lobby is austere, has a check in desk and a stand that has some individual snack items for sale. There is also a small business center area set off to the side with a computer and printer for guests, right next to the desk selling timeshares (no pressure; no one ever bothered us.) There is a small fitness room, but only two of the three machines were working. Aside from the bags of chips or pretzels for sale, there is no food available at t his hotel. There is an outdoor swimming pool and hot tub which we did get to enjoy before leaving Las Vegas. Check out is early; we had a late flight. The staff was kind enough to allow us to use the pool facilities, even though we had checked out of the room. There is a bathroom by the pool to change into one's clothes, or one can use the bathroom off the lobby. Parking is free for hotel guests. WiFi does work in room, but it took quite a bit of effort to get it working properly. There was a lot of communication back and forth with the front desk before it was operational. We much prefer staying at this type of hotel in Las Vegas; no casino, but near the strip for eating and shows. We love the elegance of the Signature at MGM and The Hilton Grand Vacations at the Flamingo. They are more expensive though. The Carriage House was a pleasant stay for the one night, and reasonably priced for a 1 bedroom during what ended up being a very busy time in Las Vegas. We ate at Mon Ami in the Paris Hotel and Sea Blue at MGM Grand. Both were good. In September we saw Cirque du Soleil's performance of "KA", which was the most spectacular show we have ever seen. This trip, we saw Cirque du Soleil's "O". It was very expensive, no two for one tickets as a tripadvisor review talked about, but had some wonderful effects and amazing circus acrobatics,synchronized swimming events and high diving, all on one small stage. I would recommend seeing "O" first, and then KA.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Las Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewZealandMolly
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 2 blocks from the strip and is very quiet. If you don't want to stay in a casino, this hotel is excellent value for money. It is easy to walk to the strip (5 mins at the most). There is a Walgreens about 15 minute walk away if you want to get in some basic provisions. The room I stayed in had a kitchenette which was more than adequate for a 5 day stay. However, it is easier if you have a car to get groceries. If you don't have a car there is the availability of groceries being delivered to you but I didn't use this service. There is coin operated washing machines and dryers on the floors and it has free wi-fi. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: TexasMomTW
Reviews.Content: So glad we found this via Trip Advisor! As other reviews have stated, the Carriage House is located about 2 blocks off the Strip, between MGM Grand and Planet Hollywood, and across from one of the back entrances to the Miracle Mile shopping mall. We felt safe and comfortable walking to and from the strip (the smut peddlers did not hang out on the side streets), and parking on their free lot (they also have a parking garage). We booked via their website, and paid about $70/night. Really appreciated the Concierge's Welcome Breakfast and presentation Sunday morning at 9:30, and the helpful brochures in the room. Lenora Wilson provided excellent service with our reservation! Also loved our spacious, quiet, non-smoking room- a nice retreat from the smoky casinos. Other guests seemed to enjoy the swimming pool. We rarely saw other guests on our floor, but did occasionally smell the food they were cooking.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky find, a very quiet, safe and secure place for young children.”
Reviews.Author: twowestaussies
Reviews.Content: We stumbled upon the Carriage house while searching for suitable accommodation for four adults and three children. We already had a short list of Hotels, but can't emphase enough how good the carriage house turned out to be in comparison with our alternatives.
