We booked two single room suites but were offered a beatiful two bedroom suite with an additional large and comfortable fold out bed. Our stay was perfect, the lights and buzz of the strip are a short walk away but none of the noise reaches the Hotel. We would definitely stay at this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JJB
Reviews.Content: This is our first visit to Las Vegas. We do not drive and do not fancy casinos so we prefer to stay on or near the Strip in an affordable accommodation without casinos. The Carriage House is an ideal choice only 2 blocks from the Strip. We stayed in a truly non-smoking one-bedroom suite. (Well, I actually had to sign to undertake that we will not be smoking in the room or I would have to pay for "damages". An ideal arrangement for non-smokers!) It's nothing luxurious but everything is clean and comfortable. We spent 3 nights there and on the last unfortunately there came a group of at least 6 who did not stop drinking and talking loudly going in-and-out of the room directly opposite to us. Lucky that it's a suite and although it was very noisy at the kitchen area, we could not hear them when we slept in the bedroom. Not sure if there's free WiFi in the room but I just could not use it. There are two PCs at the lobby and they work perfectly OK. We bought a $7 day pass for the deuce bus and we had no problems travelling often up and down the Strip. Yes, it sometimes took more than 15 minutes for the wait. As long as you plan for longer travelling time (you would better in Vegas), it's OK. We walked to Bellagio (around 20 minutes) for a wonderful breakfast at Café Bellagio. And had enjoyed the buffet dinner at Wynn. Both highly recommended. Would definitely recommended a stay in here if you are not a keen casino-goer.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: FNOBRAZIL
Reviews.Content: once you see the hotel outside, you do not realize how comfortable, friedly, comfortable and inexpensive this hotel is. Friendly Staff (everyone), clean, spacious, complete kitchen (they do not have restaurant, but have a small grocery store) , complimentary internet and.....QUIET !!!!!!! Just one block from Strip, close to MIracle MIle shopping Mall.... easy to reach most of attractions, and easy to find anything that ou want. I do recommend !

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay off the strip”
Reviews.Author: N_Franklin
Reviews.Content: Good Customer Service. Quick Check-in and Check-out. Large Suites: includes a large Living room, Dining Room, nice size bathroom and a great size kitchen. Perfect for my 5 night stay. Bedroom though is a bit small. Great Location. Slightly off the strip so less traffic. The decor is average but again you can't beat how spacious the suites are. Though I was in a non-smoking room the hallway had a stale/smoke smell. Lastly I wasn't crazy about the early morning calls for a tour of their facility. The tour includes membership to their Hotel. I would of preferred a letter placed under my door. Both times I was called they woke me up. Overall i would stay here again...see you soon Carriage House!

Reviews.Title: “This was an amazing find!”
Reviews.Author: DarbyDublin_OH
Reviews.Content: When I was quoted rates significantly below the hotels on the strip, I expected to stay in one of those slightly seedy condos in which you planned to spend as little time as possible. I was totally wrong! The Carriage House was as nice as any of the hotels in which I have stayed in Vegas, and nicer than most. It was very modern in its decor and immaculately clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The small kitchenette in the room was useful. The pool and hottub were clean and rarely crowded. It was also close to many things. Walk across Harmon and you enter PH Westgate, which gives you easy access to the Miracle Mile shops and Planet Hollywood casino. Walk south on Audrie for one block and you are at the tram stop at MGM, as well as the MGM casino. Security was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: TheFrenchMayor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is like an oasis of tranquility in the animated city. Great location, yet quiet, nested between the MGM Grand and Planet Hollywood. Easy access to the monorail, under 5mn walk. Very helpful, kind and professional employees. Friendly, comfortable, clean. Small heating outdoor swimming-pool and jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place! Inexpensive, quiet, safe & close to shops, restaurants”
Reviews.Author: dinabwilson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed this hotel right across from the Miracle Mile mall and Planet Hollywood hotel. Our suite was comfortable -- two adjoining rooms so we had a separate bedroom, living room, kitchen, mini-bar, two bathrooms. No valet parking needed here! Just park right outside the door! The pool was heated and hot tub was never crowded even though it was Spring Break. There was some loud music across the hall from us for awhile, but overall it was relatively quiet and serene compared to the crowds on the strip! Staff was informative and friendly. They recommended Oceans One restaurant across the street for $5.99 breakfast which had excellent pancakes and bacon. Highlight of our trip was kayaking right below the Hoover Dam with Evolution Excursions! http://www.lasvegaskayaktours.com/tour_half_day.html They picked us up at the hotel and drove us to the dam where we embarked on an 11-mile kayak trip down the river, stopping several times to soak in hot springs and experience a sauna cave.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: DLC7781
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weeks stay and we certainly would stay there again. Traveling with our two married children, their spouses and our granddaughter, we rented 3 rooms. All rooms were on the same floor, with two identical king rooms, recently updated, with a kitchenette including dishes, pans, etc. The third room was a 1 bedroom with full size kitchen fully stocked with all the basic pans, dishes and to my surprise, coffee, sugar, salt , pepper and paper towels. The decor of our room was a little outdated, (scheduled to be updated) but it was clean and easily accomodated our entire group for breakfast every morning and lunches on occasion. Other room features, Bathroom: large shower, hair dryer, complimentary shampoo, conditioner, toothpaste, Q-tips, kleenex and a razor!; Bedroom: Large closet with hangers, flat screen tv, room safe, iron & board; Living room: large flat screen TV with DVD player. During our stay we also used the fitness room, and the pool/hot tub and all were very clean. The staff was very nice and the housekeeping staff inquired more than once if we needed anything, and not once did we hear any noise coming from the neighboring rooms. Location to the strip for us was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful, but no breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: NorthernMom_8
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful small hotel a very short walking distance from the center of the Strip. The rooms were very clean and fairly large. The staff was very friendly. We were disappointed though that breakfast wasn't included. It meant having to go across the street to find a restaurant. This was minor though. Lovely place and a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: loves2travel201184
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic stay at the Carriage House! I was very impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel. Being a former Housekeeping Manager for a pricey resort on Cape Cod, I can ALWAYS spot something unclean from a mile away- but everything was well taken care of at the Carriage House. The only thing I would say its that certain things were a bit outdated. For example, our room had a great new bed and flat screen t.v, however, the bathroom seemed in need of remodeling. But for the price- and in Las Vegas- I could not ask for more. During our stay we felt as though we had the place to ourselves, never heard any sounds from anyone else, and the lobby never got to crowded - never a wait for using the computer, or needing to speak to a hotel representative. This would not hold true at any other Vegas hotel in my opinion. We also felt very safe, as there were security and personnel working at all hours. I notice many comments on here about the location. The location is perfect!! We were easily able to walk to and from the strip all day-- very very close. I have Rheumatoid Arthritis in my knees and ankles, so if I think it is an easy walk- it must be! The other great thing about the location is that the BEST sites on the strip are throughout the middle of the strip- which is where Carriage House is tucked behind. When you check-in, ask the representative the short-cut to the MGM- us and some other couples learned about it after we had been there a number of times. We stayed in a studio with a partial kitchen. This was the perfect size for two people to stretch out and relax after a busy day on the strip. It had a plenty of room for our luggage, a couch to watch tv from, a small/ low bar with two chairs to eat at, and the partial kitchen was great! Looking forward to coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in vegas!!!!”
Reviews.Author: macken121
Reviews.Content: We stay at The Carriage House from December 22 til January 4. We loved it. First we wanted to send a package ahead of time, we called and they said that was fine.We were really happy about that because we sent down a small christmas tree and gifts and extra things so we did not have to pack in suitcase.Then we wanted a room with view, tub, shower, full kitchen, security,we were not sure what we were going to get never being their before. Wow we were all surprise at the room, great view, large bathroom with tub and shower and bedroom with king bed, full kitchen with everything you need, livingroom,dinningroom,2 tvs flat screen. We were very happy and love the clean room.The housekeeping was the best we have ever had ALWAYS making sure we never went without anything we needed,they were all excellent!!!! The hotel staff was the best too. We have travel alot and the carriage house really cares about their guest wanting to make their stayed as great as possible. The security was so nice and you always felt secure and safe leaving your teenager alone a few hours at night. They made our Christmas and New Years the best vacation ever!!!!! Thank You Carriage House!!!!! The Best Place In Vegas!!!! If your looking for quiet, large clean rooms,great staff and houekeeping,security,everything within walking distance then this is the place for you!!!

Reviews.Title: “"Great Stay "Great Location Terrific Staff”
Reviews.Author: jaxonvj
Reviews.Content: Just returned from exchanging my Time Share to Carriage House Las Vegas OK we were on the 8th floor with a partial view of the strip This hotel is one block back from the strip next door to Planet Holliwood Walk out of CH and across the road anmd you are at the siode entrance to PH Easy Parking,Safe elevators you have to use your room key to go up In the lobby there are computers to use FREE & Printers FREE so you can print of coupons for Nate Burton etc They also have brochures one of them is for TERRIBLES now dont cringe we decided to go $10 for Dinner with one Free so $5 each we were going to blow the $10 if it was TERRIBLE But we were really pleasantly surprized its very pleasant, great wait staff they actually take the plates away and refill without promting Sorry our room was a 1 bed suite the living room was huge with a Flat Screen TV same in Bedroom Full Kitchen with everything you need Cleaning service Daily Bathroom NO TUB huge shower but tiny rest of bathroom only room for one person( but at least 4 in the shower) Free internet not wireless but they give you the cord Free 1800 calls & Local Calls..........Dont put the 702 for your local call There is a small convienance area next to reception with very basic things Pretty Basic Gym the pool is outside looked nice but ts Jan some people did venture into the Jacuzzi We were very happy with our stay and definetly be back FREE NATE BURTON tickets online upgrade to $10 for better seats its Cabaret seating which is really nice Half Price DIVA tickets a WONDERFULL SHOW VIP $52 instead of $110 again Cabaret Seating

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: aaronmh
Reviews.Content: Our friend traded in his time share in FL for a week at the Carriage House. I heard several times that this was an old place, it had no casino, don't expect much, etc. It couldn't have been more different! The lobby, the room, and the staff were all excellent. We shared a two bedroom suite with another couple plus had a last minute friend sleeping on the couch. It was roomy, clean, comfortable, and the additional bathroom made all the difference. The concierge was helpful in getting tickets to shows, tours, etc., the cleaning staff was very accomodating to our excessive use of towels, and it was good to see security at the lobby when we came home at 3-4am each morning. The lack of a casino made this a very quiet place and it was just a little bit off the strip so it was very accessible.

Reviews.Title: “All in one”
Reviews.Author: DrGerman
Reviews.Content: First I would like to point out the location. Just two block from the center of the strip, you can walk to most places without to use a car or taxi. Then, the hotel is very clean and quiet since it doesn´t have a casino, so once you get back to your room it is relax time. The hotel has a laundry room for guest to use, a nice gym (which in reality is a very good treadmill), free internet, free parking, and a nice coffemaker to enyoy every morning. I think this is a great place for people that want to enjoy a nice hotel at a great price, next to the action (not in it).

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable experience with four small children.”
Reviews.Author: sheriree
Reviews.Content: The location is great... close to the strip. The pool and tennis courts were clean and secure. In fact, the entire facility felt very secure as you needed a key card to enter the building after hours and a key card to ride the elevator at all. The staff was extremely helpful. We cooked and baked as if we were at home for a few nights and went out the rest. It was nice to have such spacious and clean accomodations. Thank you to the staff at Carriage House.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: MilesUtah
Reviews.Content: Our families stay at the Carriage House was a great experience. They are located just off the strip and will convenient access to I-15. The hotel was clean and family friendly. There was no noise, casino, or night club at the hotel itself. If you want a quite place close to all the attractions, but where you are comfortable with your young children walking around this is the place. They have a small kitchen in the room. They have movies, games and pool toys you can check-out free of charge in the lobby. Parking is free and close. You don't have to walk a quarter mile from your car to the registration desk to your room like most traditional Las Vegas hotels. The staff was friendly and personable. Thank you for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Service, Good Room--bargain all around”
Reviews.Author: BostonTravellingMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two nights--start and finish of a long road trip with kids ages 10 and 8. The service was terrific. I had a lot of back and forth with the manager, Marie, in advance of the trip. I hemmed and hawed about which room size (the rooms are decent size and even the simple rooms have fridge and microwave) and had them book our rental car at a better rate than I could find online. Marie was amazing--returning my emails in near real time and patiently guiding me through my choices and mind changing. She even negotiated with Budget so we could get picked up at the hotel to go to the rental car place--and drop it off at the airport later without extra charge. We checked into a lovely room, had nice attention from staff, and the location is superb--a street off the strip, so it's a little more quiet. But within a quick walk to everything. My only complaint was a noisy fan in our room and the fact that we couldn't leave the bathroom light on at night as a nightlight for our kids because the light came with a loud extractor fan automatically. Other than that, a very nice hotel and nice stay. Would definitely stay there again in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “If you are a non-smoker --Do not book at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: thetraveler12
Reviews.Content: There are many better hotels to stay at. If are a non-smoker you will not be happy to know evertime I stepped out to enjoy the pool (which is not heated nor nice) more than one person was smoking a cigar or ciggarette, as there are ash trays at every lounge chair. There are no shuttles from the hotel. The grocery store is 2 miles away. You will need car rental. They shorted me in my room and gave me the smallest kitchen i have ever seen. Do not rent a car through them, I had a very bad experience with different quotes and availability. This is not a premeir resort, just ahotel in need of renovation. If you have a complaint good luck getting any results. Ice machine on 9th floor. Go to Fremont street, lots of fun and good prices....the golden nugget was fun!!!

Reviews.Title: “would have been better if room did not smell of smoke”
Reviews.Author: BristolBaz
Reviews.Content: The size of the rooms is good and the location is fine - just off the strip. The pool is not up to much but we didn't need it. However our room stank of smoke and they couldn't move us so they supplied a unit that was supposed to get rid of the smell. It didn't work.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: piddyman
Reviews.Content: Normally when I stay in Vegas its at Staybridge Suites which is a great hotel at a great price. However, I wanted something closer to the center of town and after some research, felt like I the Carriage House was a good alternative. The price and location are pretty good - close to the action but not right in the heart which, for me, was good. The rooms are well-appointed and big enough. Yet, there were significant downsides. The air conditioner is in a close near the bed and when it turns on its like a jet engine. This made for some rude awakenings in the middle of the night. The pool loses any direct sun after 3 so there is no option for some good pool time after work. The wireless internet is practically non-existent - no more than one bar if I could get a signal at all. For the price and the good deals to be found in Vegas right now, I would recommend staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good value option near the strip”
Reviews.Author: Warleggan1
Reviews.Content: The Carriage House is a very good option if you are looking for a quiet non casino hotel near the strip. It is located a few minutes walk to the strip next to Planet Hollywood. The room, a King studio with kitchen, was quiet, comfortable and very well equiped. The internet worked OK with my laptop, although was rather slow at times, but this appears to be a general problem with hotel internet in America. The staff were always friendly and helpful. You need your room key to operate the lift which is a useful security feature. One gripe which has been mentioned in other reviews. We requested a non-smoking room. The room allocated, a non smoking room on the 7th floor, had a strong smell of tobacco on arrival. After a long tiring car journey, we decided we did not want the hassle of complaining and demanding a different room. During the 3 day stay, the smell almost totally went, probably because we left the windows open as much as possible. But this suggests the management are quite prepared to allocate rooms to guests who specifically requested non-smoking, without ridding the room of smoke caused by previous guests, who presumably flouted the the non-smoking rule.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great price!!”
Reviews.Author: tweetydee2
Reviews.Content: When looking for a hotel to stay at in Las Vegas, I found this one and decided on it because it was a short distance off the strip which I assumed meant quiet. I was totally right! This is a great hotel at a great location. Just a few blocks from the main strip in Vegas. The rooms were very large and had everything we needed and then some. We weren't in the rooms much but when we got there, it was certainly a treat! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Vegas and not wanting to stay in one of the casino hotels. It's a very nice hotel at a very nice price! I also liked the fact that you had to use your room key to go up in the elevator which means people off the street can't come in and wander around the hotel. I will definitely stay here again should I ever return to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here every year”
Reviews.Author: labbifri
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Carriage House for years. Love that we don't have to bring our bag through a casino to get to our room or park far away. Also like having a kitchen that I can make breakfast and not have to go out in the morning. You must ask for a non-smoking floor. Otherwise you will smell smoke from other rooms. It is adjacent to Planet Hollywood Casino across the street so you can go through there to hit strip or walk 1 1/2 blocks to strip. Once there you are pretty much in the center of things. Great location, clean with free computer use in the lobby so I don't have to bring my laptop. Otherwise free internet in the room. Rooms are clean and spacious. Check out fashion mall and the two outlets Vegas has to offer besides casinos. Also get over to Town Square. Rent a car to get out of the area and explore all the other sites Vegas has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Little GEM in the heart of LAS VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: Dazzyb1979
Reviews.Content: What a place !! We arrived on Sept 10th in Las Vegas for the 1st time a little worried that we would be far from the strip and that we would regret not staying in one of the huge famous hotels, but i can honestly say we were over the moon when we arrived, here's a list of all the plus points of this little gem of a hotel:- * Less than a 1 minute walk to the main strip (not near the noise but close enough to get to) * Hotel rooms and lobby Clean to the extreme daily * Maids are amazing and even washed up for us which they did not have to do * Pool was not busy and a nice size, although compared to other hotels you may think is a little small * Internet FREE, and the kind lady behind reception also printed anything we needed for free too * Fridge and a microwave included in a very spacious modern hotel room. * Taxi's arranged for you on request which arrive sharpish * Laundry available on our floor for only a dollar which came in very handy Hope this comes in useful and if your already booked puts your mind at ease.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is the best.”
Reviews.Author: louisashaw80
Reviews.Content: I have visited the Carriage twice now and loved it both times. This trip we had a studio with a kitchenette. The hotel has just been refurbished and it was lovely. Very modern and clean. All the amenities you need. The king beds are massive, real American high beds, there is a flat screen TV as well. It is set down the side of Planet Hollywood and if you have a strip view you can see the hotels at night. The pool is great, very clean and big enough to swim or play ball in. We went to some of the larger hotels to see theirs pools and they were very busy. The staff cant do enough for you.... also the house keeping service is great. I love this hotel and will be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, good location !”
Reviews.Author: XxGemmaxX
Reviews.Content: We stayed here simply because we had a timeshare. When we booked there was originally 6 people going so we booked a 6 person room but in the end there was only 2 of us. The room was very big, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, lounge, kitchen and dining room. the place was clean and house keeping come in daily, making our beds, emptying bins an leaving fresh towels. We booked tickets downstairs and the woman who did it for us was really helpful. The location was really good, right in between mgm an planet hollywood and within walking distance to the strip. There isn't anything bad i can say about this hotel apart from the rooms are a bit dated but rooms were getting renovated whilst we were there (not that you would notice because we could not hear a thing) It was also annoying that to use the internet you had to plug your laptop into the ethernet cable, wifi would definitely be best and more convenient to people with modern technology. Also the "shop" downstairs could do with a major improvement, its not convenient having to go out if you wanted a quick snack or sandwich. All in all was a comfortable stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, comfortable and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: FolsomBill
Reviews.Content: We stayed there the 6th thru the 13th and were very satisfied. We had a one bedroom on the 7th floor and were impressed with the condition of the unit. Although it is not new amenities were very clean and did not show signs of excessive wear. They do not have wi-fi; however, we had no problem hooking up to the wired ethernet which was free. The bed was very comfortable and the unit was quiet,which we enjoyed as "Vegas" is loud everywhere. We had a non smoking room and the smoke smell from other areas was almost undetectable. Staff was very pleasant and helpful so we find it strange that some reviewers state they were rude. We had no problem with taxis and never waited longer than 15 minutes at any time. We liked the location as it is accross the street from the Miracle Mile and Planet Hollywood. We spent alot of time at the Miracle Mile which has shows, restaurants and shops. Yes, it is not a luxury hotel but it is also not a rat race like they are. We would stay at the Carriage House again if we return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great space for family while staying on the Strip - but room had been used by a smoker”
Reviews.Author: bossladymum
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bed apartment which was great space after sharing double double rooms for the privious 2 weeks. The apartment came with a fully equipt kitchen, dining area and sitting area (which had a pull out sofa bed). Laundry facilites were located on the same floor which was excellent. While the room we were allocated was supposed to be non smoking it did have an overwhelming smoke smell especially when the aircond was initially turned on each day after the cleaning staff had attended to the room. The kids slept on the pull out sofa bed which was a great size. The air VERY NOISY conditioner was located in a cupboard near the sofa. Tried a night without aircon and opening the windows - but the room was still stuffy. The walk to the Vegas Strip isnt far. No parking fees. Self parking only in non secured parking area. No problem getting a car space. There is a small pool which was fine for the family crowd. While it was worth having the additional space (instead of sharing a small room) the Carriage House was a little disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Tolerable but wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: Peachleaf
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas with two of my best girlfriends, one of whom had a timeshare that she traded for the Carriage House. Two of us had been to Vegas before so we knew what to expect. We were looking for a fun, relaxing weekend away in Vegas. Overall, I was not thrilled with the Carriage House. Make no mistake, this is a very utilitarian hotel. If that's what you're looking for... then you won't be disappointed. Location: The Carriage House is located on the corner between two very busy streets and about 3 blocks from the strip. It is across the street from a mall and a few hotels. Although it's not bad for walking... it is impossible to get a cab from there. Because of the location, we took a cab to a few places (for shows and for night life) and we always had a wait. We had to wait for almost an hour for a cab back to the airport in 100 degree heat. Not fun! Room: The room we had slept four people: two on a bed and two on a pull out couch. I was on the pull out couch... which bowed in the middle and made my back hurt. The room had a kitchen and a small bathroom. Everything was very basic and terribly out of date. Overall it was clean and got the job done. Ammenities: They do have a pool on-site and it does the job. Just don't be fooled by the photos... this is a very small pool. There was no wireless internet... we were given a cord for the modem but couldn't get it to work at all (one of us works with computers for a living so it wasn't us!). They did offer a few computers downstairs that you could check your email on for free. Useful for email but not useful if you need to do any work. The workout room is very small and only offers a few treadmills. People: The women at the front desk were always a little rude and curt with us. Other hotel guests were friendly and helpful. Although having a kitchen was convenient, I wouldn't stay there again. There are so many other inexpensive places to stay on the strip that are much nicer, offer more/better amenities, and are more convenient. If you're looking for a glamorous and exciting Las Vegas trip... look elsewhere! For the same price, you can get a deal at one of the large casino-hotels (that have food and entertainment right on site!).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Gastronome37
Reviews.Content: The location almost couldn't be better. One block from the Strip and an easy walk (although very hot one) to the Bellagio for the fountains and buffet. The rooms were clean and spacious. The staff was friendly. And although some renovation was being done to a room a few doors away from us, we never heard a sound. The only minor negative was that the pool was located across the entrance drive but otherwise was very nice, albeit small.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: IDTRAVLR9
Reviews.Content: If you don't like the casino hustle and bustle and want a clean, comfortable, and spacious suite, try the Carriage House. This was our third stay and each stay was very enjoyable. It's like having your own apartment right off the Strip. The pool is small by LV standards but quite adequate. Some of the suites seem a bit dated but they are being upgraded. The full kitchen allows a guest to avoid the hassle of going out for breakfast and offers a respite from the costly LV restaurants. This is, I believe, a fractional ownership/time share property but you don't get that sense (or the sales pitches that many give you) when you stay there. The staff was friendly and competent.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for the price!”
Reviews.Author: ATLtraveler
Reviews.Content: Its a good thing I didn't pay too much attention to the negative reviews here, as the Carriage House was in an excellent location for the price. We had a 1 bedroom with a fold out sofa in the living room; and although no sheets were provided for the fold out, it came quickly upon our request. The room, bedding and towels were clean and of semi-okay quality. There was no smell of smoke in our room or in the hallways and for the most part everything was pretty quiet. It's the ideal place to stay if you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “The Carriage House location was perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Joads
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was awesome. They were super nice but the only thing that bothered me was that everytime we had a question like "can we get a number for a restraunt?" or "can we have a luggage cart sent up?" their answer was "come down to the front desk to get it." They were never able to bring the information to us or send someone with it. Other than that the room was amazing. Came fully equiped with a kitchen, so we brought alot of food that way we could spend all our money on "fun times" instead of eating! That was helpful! The location was awesome because its right next to Planet Hollywood where we spent most of our time and we could walk the strip when we would go anywhere else. I would deffinently stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay and won't be our last”
Reviews.Author: luci5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carriage House for the second time in May. We were allocated the same room as last time so it really felt like home from home. I won't repeat myself, but see my review dated 15 Feb 2010. Staff are friendly and helpful and we like the facilities on offer such as the free internet and laundry facilities. Our suite had brand new flat screen TV's in the lounge and bedroom from the last time we stayed. We have already booked to go back twice in September. This time we have opted for a full bathroom and kitchenette rather than shower only and a full kitchen. Please note that the hotel is NOT smoke free and doesn't state that it is so I don't know why some reviewers think that it is. Approx 25% of the rooms are smoking optional. I have recommended the CH to someone on another forum and he has booked as it seems perfect for a family who don't want a casino onsite. The Carriage House wouldn't suit those who are looking for luxury. There are plenty hotels in Vegas that would suit them better. However it is extremely comfortable. We tend to hotel hop and stay at 4-5 hotels each 2 week trip. We have stayed everywhere from the Imperial Palace to the Four Seasons so we know the difference in quality and facilities available. The CH meets our need perfectly for part of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, large unit”
Reviews.Author: FrimousseMontreal
Reviews.Content: We rented a unit with a fully equiped kitchen. It was appreciated because we could at least eat breakfast and some dinner in our unit. With the separate room, the spouse can be up late and never disturb the other one. Two blocks from the Planet Hollywood hotel and the strip. Room service every day. Because it is not on the strip, it is quiet at night time, Its a good thing because Vegas strip doesn't sleep. Not luxury but clean and simple. Staff is very polite, always there. Good security even in nighttime. If you want a nice quiet vacation after a walk on the strip, it is the hotel. But if you want casino on place, luxury and noice, dont go at the Carriage House.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: roadtriphalifax
Reviews.Content: We were 4 adults on a 3 week road trip. Spent 3 very pleasant nights at the Carriage House . This non-casino hotel is located about a 5 minute stroll east of the strip and is more or less adjacent to the MGM and across the street from the Million Dollar mile. Our rooms were very large with 1 king bed, well equipped kitchenette and a large bathroom. Everything was very clean and the bed was quite comfortable. I believe there is a laundry on most if not all floors. The high speed worked well and there is a busniness centre in the lobby area as well as lounge type area with a small library. The staff are friendly, courteous and most helpful. The rooms are quiet and non-smoking. I do believe that some of the rooms are time share units and there is usually a lady at a desk in the lobby that tries to interest you in a hour long presentation of time share sell-offs in this unit and other locations, but she was not pushy. They leave an envelope in your room with coupons for a few items and you collect them in the lobby, so if you are not interested, just ignore the envelope. There is also free parking. We would highly recommend this facility.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!!”
Reviews.Author: ksnj2
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our stay at The Carriage House. The location was PERFECT 2 short blocks from the middle of the strip (MGM, Bellagio, Paris). Someone wrote that the pool only gets 2 hours of sun per day? That concerned me a little but the reality was the sun was on the pool from about 10:30 am until about 3:45 pm - PLENTY of time to be out in the sun. It is located directly across the entrance to The Miracle Mile center which has EVERYTHING you could need! We rented a car and hiked Red Rock Canyon, we took an airplane to the Grand Canyon! The entire vacation was perfect. The staff was very helpful, rooms BIG and clean. Free internet and printing so it was easy to obtain our boarding passes when we left. I would most DEFINITELY stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Total Rip-off”
Reviews.Author: efjermedal
Reviews.Content: Stayed there three nights and got totally nickeled and dimmed by their outrageous fees. The staff was alright and the rooms weren’t bad but the management was horrible and the GM lady thought she was a mobster and told me and others that "you don't know who your messing with" when we inquired about be overcharged by CH room fees. I would definitely avoid unless to plan on leaving the room spotless when you leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Bug3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property last weekend and thought it was an excellent value! My two room suit was cozy/small, but amazing for the price. My room was very clean, the bed was comfortable and I was suprised by the fully equipped kitchen. Its location was very convienient to the central part of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “This is NOT a smoke free hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kat1999
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel and it was fine. The second we got off the elevator, ewww... it smelled of musty smoke. Our room was just as smokey, it was gross! We called down about getting a new room and the front desk said there were no more rooms available and that we were in fact on a smoking floor. It was so gross, we opened the window and then had to listen to the street noise all night. We checked out first thing the next morning (3 days early). We would not stay here again, the room was run down as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: blessed379
Reviews.Content: At first was unsure because never heard of this hotel. After reading the reviews decided to give it a whirl. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The room was emmaculate and we are happy we decided to stay at a non-gaming hotel and smoke-free. For busines this was great we were suppose to stay in Planet Hollywood. The internet and printing is free (in the rooms also). Will definitely stay here if ever in Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: pinkba
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay at The Carriage House again. The experience was excellent. The rooms are really clean, they have everything you need, the attention is great and the location is excellent. Just one block from the strip, and really cheap for being a Saturday night. The only problem was the sofa bed; it was uncomfortable and noisy but everything else was just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Gem Among the Big Boys”
Reviews.Author: Gebbis
Reviews.Content: This has become my hotel of choice when visiting Vegas! Quietly tucked in behind the big towers, this suite hotel has everything you need, close to the action, quiet when you actually want to sleep and outstanding service. No extra charges here. Free internet and printing for those boarding passes and for staying in touch with home. Our room was spacious and had every thing we needed. The bathroom fixtures are dated but the place was spotless and the walk-in closet and tons of storage space made our week long visit a breeze. Too bad they don't have the shuttle to the grocery store anymore...but the Deuce will take you to Whole Foods.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal for a full suite close to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: SeaG35
Reviews.Content: The reviews for this hotel are spot on, the suites are large with a useable kitchenette, large bedroom with king size bed and nice bathroom with tub and shower. It's a bit noisy at night on the street side with the monorail, so recommend asking for a room on the pool side. The staff were friendly and accommodating, and the rooms were clean. Great pool and spa - plus tennis courts. An early check in was no problem. No pressure to attend a time-share meeting. Small 'store' in lobby carried food and laundry items. Laundry on each floor. And best of all the rate was $ 79 a night - we ate out once a day and spend our 'savings' on shows and gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there for honeymoon and loved it!”
Reviews.Author: capricious08
Reviews.Content: Great location... Short walk to the strip. No smoking and quiet since there's no casino in the building. I had a 1 bedroom suite for $89 a night... I have no complaints and when we go back to Vegas we will stay there again! Save dollars on the room so you can spend it in Vegas! Downside - Pool is a bit small and you only get sunshine on the pool until about 2 or 3p.

Reviews.Title: “Bathrooms were disgusting”
Reviews.Author: berowramum
Reviews.Content: The only real problem we had with this place was getting the blocked drains in the Shower Bath and Toilet cleared by management after a number of complaints. My husband had stayed there without incident the week before and had no problems, but he moved into an apartment when we joined him.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, very centrally located”
Reviews.Author: shlmenhosh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a week in exchange for Wyndham points. I agree with other reviewers that the staff was great - friendly and helpful. We had a one bedroom studio suite and it was as big as my first apartment. There was a living room separated from the bedroom by a vertical shade. There was a small dining table and then a pretty good sized full kitchen. It was very quiet there, we never heard anyone in the other rooms, even though they were full. If you're looking for glitz and glam, go somewhere else. This was a very clean, comfortable apartment-like setting, and we really enjoyed it. We didn't opt for a grocery store, but didn't really need one (they said it was $15 each way by cab). The lobby had lots of food items at surprisingly reasonable prices, things like eggs, milk, bread, peanut butter. Everything else we needed we got at the Walgreens which was a couple of blocks away. The rooms have coffee and they'll give you more if you want. I'm pretty picky about coffee, and I thought it was really good. They have a lighted tennis court and very nice pool. They give you the tennis equipment to use, and have basketball too. They have a big selection of dvd's and videos, also complimentary. They're mostly older titles, but some good ones. Someone else complained about the internet, that the cord kept you and your computer at the counter. They gave us one that was about 10 feet long, so we could use it anywhere in the room. We walked everywhere, but if you don't like to walk, you should probably get a car. It's not too far off the strip, but it is a couple of big blocks, and most of the casinos are a mile or two away. The Planet Hollywood shopping mall is almost right across the street. When we first arrived, they sent us to the concierge to 'enter a drawing', which was code for 'sign up for a timeshare talk'. The guy was really nice, but we were tired and just wanted to put our stuff down and he wouldn't stop talking. We did sign up for the timeshare talk and it was not bad at all. It was about an hour with a very nice, non-pressuring woman. She asked us questions about what we already own and what we like to do, and it was clear that we were happy with what we have. We told her we weren't going to buy anything more and she was very gracious about it. For doing that, we got a $100 voucher for a Brazilian restaurant across the street. TIP: What they don't tell you until after the presentation is that the $100 doesn't include alcohol or the 15%gratuity. The dinner buffet is $49 each, so there's your $100, plus whatever you drink, plus tax and tip. We thought that was pretty misleading. So here's what we did: We went for lunch. The buffet was $29 each, which left $40. We ordered three entrees to go and took them back to the room. Our bill came to just under the $100, and we paid another $20-25ish for the tax/tip, but had a couple of extra meals from it. (very good meals!) We had a great, relaxing time and it was a clean, comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Accomodation a block off the strip!”
Reviews.Author: swing
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Carriage House for a week in January. We were quite exhausted after driving for three days. I requested a condo in a quiet area of the building, and this was granted. The front end staff on all accounts were very friendly and accommodating. Our condo was quiet, clean and spacious. We couldn't get the heating regulated though, and a serviceman was sent up immediately. He found many of the vents had been closed by previous clients causing the problem. This week was indeed a very pleasant and positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bet In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: boflex
Reviews.Content: This suite hotel was one block off the strip. Easy walk to the action, but no problem to get in and out of with a car. Nice heated pool, tennis court, basketball, shuffleboard (all sports equipment provided....FREE) I asked for a rollaway bed on the way out for dinner and it was promptly delivered to my room before I got back in. A faucet broke early one morning and a repairman was in my room less than 5 minutes after I called to report it. Security was nice, you needed your room key just to enter the lobby after 10 pm, and always needed it to go up the elevators any time of day. Nice folks, clean room, great service, free internet, made for a wonderfull stay....we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place again”
Reviews.Author: wsm4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Carriage House for 1 week from Halloween 09. We returned to this hotel again after 1st visiting in 2005 and were impressed by the upgrade the rooms and hotel have received. We booked 2 rooms as our son came with us and both rooms were large and comfortable. Reception area has also been renovated with good quality furnishings. Staff are very helpful and courteous. Visited Utah and Death Valley whilst staying this time, both an easy day trip. There is a lot of building work being carried out on the strip between the Monte Carlo and Bellagio hotel (which is not far from the Carriage House) this makes the area dusty. Also the entrance to Harmon Avenue from the strip is being changed, this isn't too much of a problem but something you should be aware of if driving in Vegas. Vegas is a fun city with plenty to do, the Carriage House is a 5 minute walk from the strip and gives a welcome bit of peace and quiet when you turn in for the night. The hotel could benefit from a small bar or restaurant but with the strip so close it's not an essential addition the management should make. We would definetly stay at the Carriage House again if we retuned to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very polite friendly staff - rooms better than average”
Reviews.Author: ukbod
Reviews.Content: A time share week in amongst an extended holiday - the Carriage house seems well organised. Security is good. The room was adequate if not over equipped - the internet is via cable only ( available for a small deposit at the check in). TV channels poorly selected and pay per view relatively expensive despite small range and not especially current. Internet available free just of the lobby. The pool was clean and tidy but we couldnt use it much due to a cold snap. The hotel is situated just off the Strip behind Planet Hollywood and has a small but well equipped exercise room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff and Service”
Reviews.Author: LisM3
Reviews.Content: We traded our timeshare in Gatlinburg, Tn for a week at the Carriage House. Even though it's a timeshare, they also book as a regular hotel. It's not the Mandaly but I would return to the Carraige House again.The front desk staff was friendly and accomodating. My dad joined us on our trip and we needed extra room. We were upgraded for very little money to the roomiest 2 bedroom suite I've ever seen. I'ts a 2 block walking distance to the noisy and crowded Vegas Blvd. but you would never know from the quietness of the hotel.One block from the Miracle Mile shopping center which has tons of shops, restaurants, and even some entertainment venues. The hotel lobby has been upgraded. The penthouse floor which is where we were at is being renovated so I assume the rest of the floors will be too.Free wi-fi and daily maid service which you would hardly never find in a timeshre resort. All in all, we highly recommend the Carriage House

Reviews.Title: “What's that smell? and Other Carriage House Quirkiness”
Reviews.Author: leliathomas
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised that the reviews for the Carriage House are so glowing. The Carriage House is an older hotel that needs a lot of work. My husband and I had booked an eight-night stay, only to cancel seven of those nights, in favor of the Paris Hotel on the Strip. The most overwhelming issue my husband and I encountered when we walked into the Carriage House's tiny, claustrophobic elevator and our floor's hallway (floor 8) was the smell of what I can only figure must be air deodorizer to mask possibly the scent of times when Carriage House allowed smoking. If that's not what the smell can be attributed to, I'm not sure what it is. It is very unpleasant. The room we stayed in was dingy, for the most part. The decor needs updating, as it gives off a dark, yellowed feel to everything, but more than anything the rooms need to be cleaner. The small bathroom in our king bed suite, which might possibly win the award for World's Narrowest Doorway (good thing we aren't fat!), has very old faucet fixtures that look like they need a better clean. The grout of the handicapped shower, which I assume comes automatically when you get the king bed suite, is very old and moldy, if not completely wearing away. The Carriage House is really not nice enough for me to want to stay, and I don't even think it is good value for money. For only $10-$20 more a night, on average, you can stay at one of the nicer Strip hotels for a longer stay of, like, a week. Add to this the fact that, while the Carriage House does sport an unbelievable location, it's not that great at the moment (as of Oct 2009), due to the extensive roadwork being done on Las Vegas Blvd. With pedestrian walks being blocked off in numerous areas, it can actually be quite tricky to navigate back to the Carriage House from certain places without walking a long distance; you get trapped in pedestrian walk areas that have been set up for construction purposes. In other words, what the Carriage House has most going for it, its location, isn't worth the money, either. The Carriage House could be a good place to stay, if they update it more and clean it a bit better. The suite we were in was very large with a real kitchen and would have been nice to stay in, otherwise. Unfortunately, it just wasn't for us.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet place to stay in middle of all the craziness Vegas has to offer”
Reviews.Author: kjochims28
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was right off the strip (just a couple minutes walking distance) and wasn't a gaming hotel. Because of this, our hotel was super-quiet, clean and nice. No drunk people stumbling the halls at all hours of the night like at other hotels we've been to. The room was very spacious (King suite) and was surprising one of their smallest suites, they have much nicer and larger ones available. Staff was friendly and the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet nights ....”
Reviews.Author: GloballyConscious
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at The Carriage House. We chose this property based on the tripadvisor reviews, which were accurate. We upgraded from the hotel room to an one bedroom suite, and were charged less than what the rack rate suggested. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The location is fine - just one block back from the strip, without the associated throng of people and noise. We could hear no noise at all from our room. Parking is a dream, and if you hire a car it means you can avoid the strip totally. We will definitely stay here again if we find ourselves in Vegas once more.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: NCtraveler2009
Reviews.Content: Positives: Good overall value for money paid, would stay here again. Located close to many big hotels (MGM grand, planet hollywood, bellagio, Paris) so made it easy to go and see the attractions here. Also close to Hawaiian Marketplace, so shopping is close by too. Negatives: 1. The smell of tobacco in the walkways is disgusting. The smell is milder but present in the non-smoking rooms also. 2. The cooling system was awfully loud in our room. It would wake us up if we were sleeping when it switched on, and we had to raise the volume on the TV by 10 every time it switched on. 3. The fact that the internet is complimentary is good but would be better if it were wireless. A laptop is pointless if we can only use it at the desk. 4. The only ice machine in the entire hotel on the 9th floor did not work.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: WildBillFlorida_USA
Reviews.Content: The carriage house is accross from the Miracle mile shops in the Planet Hollywood, and on block off the strip. The staff are extremely helpful and nice. My partner had left her phone charger at home, and was very unhappy. She asked the desk where she could find a T-mibile store to buy another one. They brought out a box with +100 chargers that had been left by guests. We got one for free. The commode needed work and the TV was difficult to figure out: help was received within 5 minutes of each call to resolve the problem. The one bedroom that we had was very spacious with a large new kitchen. We were at the back where we experienced no noise. Cons: no restaurant, small gift shop, small pool. Pros; Friendly, helpful, staff; location; quality of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Non Gambler”
Reviews.Author: Amavisti
Reviews.Content: Great hotel if you are there for the sightseeing, shows, Grand Canyon etc. We had a two room suite with walk-in wardrobe an kitchenette, free broadband (cable supplied), two TVs etc. Small shop in the lobby, and there is also a small general store in the Miracle Mile. No restaurant, but good breakfasts etc to be had in the Miracle Mile. Concierge Marie recommended and booked tour to Grand Canyon (highlight of the trip). She also gives a talk on Sunday mornings, full of advice and information. Thank you Marie!! Location is perfect, just off the strip. Close to all the casinos (worth seeing even if you are not a gambler. Low point of the trip was in the Mirage. We had booked tickets for "LOVE". Computers had broken down when we arrived, an hour before the show. We queued for nearly 100 mins. During this time, security staff refused to let our young son sit ANYWHERE. One charmer even thought it was smart to be sarcastic to him. Nuckleheads.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for large groups and good location, but not as nice as I expected”
Reviews.Author: audigal
Reviews.Content: Perhaps my expectations were too high after reading the reviews here. The Carriage House is a nice hotel, but I had a number of little issues that damped my overall experienced. The hotel lobby, check-in/out, and staff are all great. The checkin process was fast. The lobby is fresh and inviting. There is a small pantry of items that was enough for us to avoid a grocery trip. The location is as expected. It is directly across the street from the side enterance to planethollywood's end of the Miracle Mile. You must walk about 200 ft to the stop light to cross. There is heavy construction so the side walk is torn up, but they have created a temporary walk way. You can continue the full block to the Strip, or walk through PlanetHolly wood to get to the strip. We usually walked down the back street along the monorail line to the back enterance to MGM. This is about 200 yard easy walk. We then could easily walk through the MGM to NYNY, Excalibur etc. The main concerns I had with our stay was the quality of the room. We had a 1 bedroom suite. The furnishings were fine and the beds comfortable (as comfortable as a sofa bed can be). The linens were of good quality. However, the upkeep on the room itself was poor. The wall paper was old. The ceilings are very low (especially in the hall way). The kitchen was very poorly stocked. We only had one spoon, no forks, no bowls, a couple small plates. We used the cooking pots as bowls. The room overall was dark and didn't feel inviting. The bathroom/shower is very small The biggest issue was that the A/C wasn't strong enough to keep the room cool. We were just two people going to vegas for a vacation. However, if you are bringing a big group of people, this would be a fine hotel as the layout of the rooms allows for multiple families to stay near each other and have the ease of a kitchen. There is free high speed internet, but it is wired only (no wireless). Maid service is daily for the beds/bath. Taxi service available and the strip shuttles from the airport also knew of this location and worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic gem of a Hotel just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Superscoobyspeed
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Carriage House from 26th June for 1 week along with 10 members of my family. The hotel is located in the perfect place just one block from the strip just down from Planet Hollywood and Harley Davison Cafe. Between us we had 2 one bed and 1 two bed apartments/suites. All had a living area with flatscreen TV, a full kitchen with oven, hob, microwave, coffee maker, dishwasher and a full sized fridge/freezer. The bedrooms all had a TV and plenty of wardrobe space and the bathroom was large and clean with shower and hairdryer. Cleaning service was every day with beds made and towels changed. As these are timeshare/self catering rooms then during your stay it is up to you to keep the rest of the place tidy. A hoover is provided as well as a full sized iron and board. The hotel reception had a seating area with TV and two computers with free internet access. There was a small gym with a treadmill,cross trainer and exercise bike. The staff were friendly and helpful with nothing too much trouble. Outside there was a tennis court and a small pool. There were plenty of sunbed and a small jacuzzi. Due to the high buildings the sun is at the pool between 10am and 2pm. The pool is open until 10pm and always kept clean and tidy. There were always plenty of car parking spaces . There was a laundry room on each floor with a small fee for washing and drying clothes. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice place”
Reviews.Author: hldMichigan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one week stay at The Carriage House. Like so many others have said, this place is a little gem tucked away about a block off of the strip. We had a one bedroom with a full kitchen. The bed was quite comfortable, ample storage space for clothes. Parking was free and never a problem. We walked everywhere and found the location of the hotel to be perfectly placed on the strip. The pool was small, but very clean and had a good supply of lounge chairs. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: shazzie6
Reviews.Content: It was very central and safe for a family. Very good price for a neat tidy room. Had cooking facilities. Very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to the strip, quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MonanMatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed from May 16th-23rd, its a great location just off the strip but centrally located. There were 8 of us, the room accomodated us well. Cleaners came through daily which we did not expect, the larger bedroom had a massive closet which fitted all of our suitcases in for storage. The Kitchen was fully equiped, with large stove/oven, full size fridge and dishwasher. Three TV's, coin operated laundry down the passage. Pool was out the front in the carpark with tennis courts and basketball court above the carpark. Straight across the road was Planet Hollywood with shopping mall, supermarkets were a couple of miles from the strip, the closest one was south on the strip called Whole Foods market but be aware this is a organic supermarket so it is pricey. The Bellagio is just around the corner with its beautiful water show. This hotel is centrally located along the strip without the noise. There is a lot of construction going on on the strip and we found the streets very dirty. Bring comfortable shoes, that accomodate for the heat as the ground surface gets extremely hot. Fremont street is magnificent something you just cant miss, although it is a couple of miles north on the strip it is worth seeing. Hoover Dam is worth a drive too, a massive bridge is being built across it at the moment which is stunning to see. We also stopped at Lake Mead on the way back to drip our feet in. Overall the lights are spectacular, the crowds are amazing at night, the heat is not so nice. We ate at the MGM Grand Buffet which we thought was good value for money, $30per head. The conceige was very informative and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Rawledawg
Reviews.Content: My friends stayed at a hotel on the strip and they didn't have as good as a room as mine. Felt like a miniature apartment. A great place to stay once you spent all day walking up and down the strip. Real peaceful too, not all that constant traffic all over the place too. The workers there were wonderful, always trying to make your stay better. If they only had flight packages to go with their inexpensive rates I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Lesmira1960
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 11.00pm and check-in was quick and without fuss. Our room was clean, quiet and had a kitchenette with all the utensils we needed. There was a laundry on our floor ($1.25 wash, $1.00 dry) and a business centre on the ground floor with 2 computers and a lounge area. Although we didn't use them it also has a swimming pool and tennis court. The Carriage House is about half a block from The Strip and closest to Planet Hollywood and MGM Grand. The price was very reasonable and I would have no hessitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice for families”
Reviews.Author: LMK5
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5, with 3 kids ages 8-10, stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in April 2009. Our room was a one bedroom suite which included a full kitchen, a king bed in the bedroom, and a sofa sleeper with 2 additional chairs that converted into single beds in the living area. The room was very clean and roomy. It was very easy to park here and there was a tennis court and pool in the back. I would say the best feature of this hotel was that you could walk about a block to the Miracle Mile Shops and the strip. You're very close to all the action but not so close where you have to deal with the crowds and driving issues. This hotel is a no-brainer for anyone who wants to experience Vegas but also retain a more traditional accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: lou256
Reviews.Content: We arrived here on Friday 10th April at around 12pm with myself, my husband and 2 teenage kids, where the staff hapily checked us in and gave us our rooms. We were given 2 rooms on the 4th floor: 2 bed apartment Pros: Large 6 foot bed En-suite bathroom Dressing table and chair Walk in closet A 2nd bedroom with a large king size bed, with tv and a bathroom oposite which included a large walk in shower! The living area was huge, with a huge sofa, which could seat 8, which can also make a double bed. There is a table and chairs, and a large kitchen with everything you will need. Also there is a modem for internet which is great. Bad point: The master bedrooms bathroom needs a bit updating, maybe with a shower instead of a bath. We also had a 1 bedroom apartment which was large and could sleep 4, the bathroom was huge with everything you will need with 2 tv's. The hotel staff are excellent, including the concierage lady and the reception staff, they were happy to help anytime for taxi's and car hire. Also when I asked for a member of staff to fix my bath tub, a man came up within 5 minutes to fix the problem! The best part about the carriage house is that there is no casino, so you dont have to walk through a huge casino to check in or go to the pool. We would definetley return to the carriage house if we came back to vegas, as the hotel was the best part of the holiday, but this time we would just have the 2 bed apartment as it was enough room for 6 people!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: gg99
Reviews.Content: The Carriage House provided an amazing "bang for the buck". Got a large suite, including a full-size kitchen, with 2 TVs. The room was very clean. Check-in was quick and efficient. Free coffee was available in the room or in the lobby. The hotel is a short walk from Planet Hollywood. Small exercise room is available all night. The only downsides: 1. The hall smelled of smoke, something that I am not used to, although seems to be common everywhere in Las Vegas 2. There is no casino on-site of course - MGM is a few block walk, but that gets you to the back of the hotel, far from the casinos, etc. I suggest the shorter walk to Planet Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Not glitzy, but a great value for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dchicag0
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at this all suite hotel - each time a different size unit. All units are large plus include either a kitchenette or full kitchen fully equipped with everything you need including a daily supply of decaf/reg coffee and paper towels. Your bathroom includes a great supply of towels never given in the hotels I have stayed in, a good looking shower curtain and bathroom rug, cotton swabs and cotton balls. In short, they give the extra effort. It's so clean my boyfriend thought we were in a new room. The room decor is great and I have never had to make a request to housekeeping. I know when I check in it will be a great stay. Only area that could use some updating is the hallways. There are washers/dryers located on assigned foors

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pmahoney
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days at the Carriage House and had a very pleasant stay. When we checked in the first room they checked us into smelled strongly like cigarette smoke (room 607) despite our request of a non-smoking room. The second room (#420) was much more to our liking and smelled just fine. The location is great. Planet Hollywood is across the street, and MGM Grand and the Bellagio are close by. The staff was always friendly and courteous, and greeted us as we came and went and made us feel at home. The rooms are very large - like a typical one bedroom apartment. They feel a bit worn out, but still are well decorated in slightly worn and outdated furnishings. The kitchen is reasonably stocked with cutlery and glasses. The cleaning staff didn't clean dishes - which isn't unusual in suites we've stayed in. The rooms did a good job with noise, but it was still possible to hear the monorail going by - and one night someone nearby had their TV turned way up and we could hear the muffled sound through the walls. Another reviewer mentioned theft - and, while I don't doubt him/her at all, we didn't have any problem with this. We left both of our laptops out while we were out during the day all four days and didn't have any issue with them or anything else going missing. Overall, the rooms are a bit aged looking, and it's definitely not a glamorous hotel, but the rooms are large and comfortable. Parking wasn't a problem. It's easy to walk everywhere. The strip is less than 5 minutes walk away. The monorail - which is fairly useless by the way - is 10 minutes walk south to MGM. Great location, inexpensive rates and a large comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED !!!!!!!!! The Carriage House”
Reviews.Author: ptkCincinnati
Reviews.Content: Great Property and Great Location !!!!!!!!!!!!!! Stayed here between Christmas and New Year's. Location could not have been much better. You are a few hundred yards from the Strip and near Plant Hollywood. This place is small and more like an older Hampton Inn or Holiday Inn Express. It is very well maintained with most of the staff having been there many years. Parking was GREAT if you have a car. Pool area is very acceptable for the size of the complex and both the pool and hot tub are heated. If you like easy access to your room and can pass on gambling all the time this is probably the best place to stay in Vegas. Plus: Location, price and parking. Not for party people Neg: If you enjoy a Casino you may be disappointed. Not for party people. Check out Ellis Island on Koval for "" GREAT "" food.

Reviews.Title: “Careful with your belongings, management does not care if taken.”
Reviews.Author: b9hs
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at this timeshare/hotel after Christmas entering the new year. I found that the while that the facility does not have the same amenities as a regular hotel, it was close to the strip, the rooms were spacious and in the end, the facility was acceptable. The security of your personal belongings is another matter. On New Year's Eve my wife decided to leave a personal article inside our room because the weather did not merit wearing it during the day. When we came back later at night, we found it was gone. No one had gone into the room other than the maid, (s) so we called our maid in and asked her about it and of course she said she did not know anything about it. The Supervisor did not even call us. Afterward, my wife, talked to the General Manager who said she would check into it, and subsequently called us to report that she had investigated this and that she felt that her maids would not do such a thing, that they had family to support, and that they needed their health insurance and that they had all been working there a long time, and suggesting if it was missing it was our fault. he made the both of feel that maybe we had been hallucinating, on drugs, lying, trying to cheat or maybe all four. Their was no offer of compensation, no other help of any kind, or even an apology. We had to take the loss. If fact, we now know that you can put a "do not disturb sign on your door" and then have the maid come in and clean while you are there. You have this option, they do not like it, but they will do it. Watch the staff. Your personal articles can also be put inside your suitcases and secured and this might deter them. The management at this hotel will not help you, they DO NOT CARE; so, be careful with your belongings...

Reviews.Title: “Carriage House - Absolutely Sensational”
Reviews.Author: jjessie
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure what to expect as I had researched a number of hotels/casinos in Vegas. Carriage House was brilliant. I had myself and 2 boys and it was extremely difficult to find a 2 bedroom or 2 room unit in USA without paying ridiculous amounts of money. The hotel room had everything we needed. The Carriage House supplied a very comfortable rollaway bed; a separate main bedroom with QS bed with separate TV and walk-in robe. Living area was very large and had a QS fold-out couch (and fold-out lounge chairs if you need them). Wide-screen plasma TV in the living area and a full serviced kitchen area. For US$100 - $120 per night you can't go wrong. Even a laundrette on almost every floor which proves extremely useful. Location was ideal - one block back from the strip. Close to Planet Hollywood and Paris Casinos. Reception was fantastic - the staff couldn't have been more friendly or helpful when we had questions. Louis Mas on reception is one of the best operators in the business. Checking into the hotel was simple and took literally less than 3 minutes (I've read that it sometimes takes ages to check-in at some of the larger Casinos). The Carriage House has 2 free p.c.'s in lobby for guest to use. A tennis court is also available and my boys used this twice while we were there. Also a lovely pool. I really can't say enough good things about the Carriage House and highly recommend it to anybody travelling to Vegas on business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Kittybat12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Carriage House for a week in mid November having booked it after reading otherTripadvisor reviews. We had a 1 bedroom suite which was elegant and comfortable. There is some construction going on but this did not bother us. The furnishings were clean and comfortable, everything worked as it should. Housekeeping was well above average, in fact all the staff were great. The location is excellent, right on the Miracle Mile shopping mall, almost centre strip, just a 5 minute walk to all the action. No casino, bar or restarant on site which made the building peaceful after all the noise and lights of the strip. Only downside was some noise from the unit next door, and the pool would probably be too small if you had energetic teenagers with you. There is some noise from the monorail at the back but hey- this is Vegas, what do you expect, it really didn't bother us.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, beginning to show its age, but can be a good value”
Reviews.Author: DenverBrian
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at Carriage House. I bit on a $69 rate over the Thanksgiving weekend after seeing the overall excellent reviews of this property. Carriage House is certainly reasonable at a low rate such as $69, but there were some quirks and the hotel is somewhat dated. Although the word "suite" is often thrown around to describe CH rooms, they're essentially standard size hotel rooms with a kitchenette (and no counter or seating associated with the tiny kitchenette either). Bathrooms are standard tub/shower combination; in my room, the drain was super slow and I needed to have the property come fix both the drain and the shower head, which was of an annoying needle-spray type. While the property did fix both issues, the slow drain should have been picked up by housekeeping or via the hotel's room PM process - it's not something a guest should have to report. The room is a late 80s vintage, with blond woods, floral print bedspreads and almond fixtures. The AC in the room was loud and loved to kick on obnoxiously, run for 2-3 minutes, then kick off with a loud sigh. Watching TV during an AC cycle meant constantly turning up and down the TV volume to compensate. When the AC was off there was definite noise from traffic and the monorail on the south side of the building. These days, Carriage House is virtually encased on all sides by large high rise condo buildings, so there is no real view from any room. TVs have been updated to flat panels, but there is no HD content available, and the TVs are recessed too far inside the armoire "hole" to allow for reasonable viewing from anywhere other than the bed. Hallways are low-ceilinged with old style drop ceilings, leading to a claustrophobic atmosphere. Most annoying was the inability to connect to the room's wired internet access. While many wireless signals (for a fee) were easily acquired, the hotel's system seems finicky on certain laptops such as ThinkPads. The hotel responded to my complaint by bringing up one of their HP laptops, connecting successfully, and then washing their hands of the issue by directing me to the wired internet provider. Two phone calls and 25 minutes on hold later, the CSR claimed their "keyboard wasn't working" and could I please call back later. I ended up paying an additional $12 to connect via one of the wireless providers. Given the overall value proposition, at $69 weekends this property can still be a reasonable choice. I think for future Vegas weekends I would likely pay $10 or even $20 more to stay at other choices, including Bill's and various Marriott/Hilton/HIExpress options.

Reviews.Title: “Bien ubicado y tranquilo”
Reviews.Author: Yaxha
Reviews.Content: Desde un punto de vista de calidad es muy superior a los hoteles-Casino, la situación es perfecta y un trato amable. Muy recomendable si quieres descansar y visitar los grandes casinos que quedan apenas a unos 100 metros y evitar las molestia de lo crowded que suele estar estos hoteles a un precio mucho mas asequible. Lo único que le falta es un desayuno continental para ser un 10 en todo los aspectos.

Reviews.Title: “went to vegas baby!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mar_rog
Reviews.Content: We had a week in vegas, and the carriage house was fabulous. The staff were so friendly and helpful, especially the concierge. It was so close to the strip but you could sleep with your window open at night and not have the noise of the strip. It took no time at all to get a cab if you needed one. The condo was so nice and clean. We ordered our groceries ahead of time through 'getaway goods.com'. It was so nice, our groceries were there and put away when we arrived. Enjoyed the cold beer when we arrived from the airport. The lobby was under construction but did not interfere with our stay at all. It was the perfect getaway. Would highly recommend it and liked it sooo much, we are staying there again on new years eve.

Reviews.Title: “Best Little Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Atreyuxin
Reviews.Content: The Carriage House is above all Clean and Friendly. Our stay at the Carriage House was for one night only but I am looking forward to returning in January. The Bed is clean and firm, the comforter is a bit scratchy but that is the only nit pick I can make about the bed. The kitchenette is dated but clean and very useful especially the mini fridge. The Widescreen HD LCD TV was a big surprise, as was the DVD player. The only other complaint I could make about this room is that when you close the shower curtain it gets dark in the shower. We got our room for under one hundred dollars a night (including tax). The Hotel is Literately 2 short blocks from the Harley Davidson restaurant on the strip. Its about a 5 minute walk to the Miracle Mile "mall" (indoor walking) which brings you right to the PH hotel and casino (nice buffet @ PH). What a stunning value to find in popular Las Vegas. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem!”
Reviews.Author: colmac56
Reviews.Content: Saw that the Carriage House got constantly good reviews so thought we would have a go rather than chance Priceline. It was everything we hoped it would be. Check in was quick and effecient and we were on our way to our 7th floor room. Did I say room? Full kitchenette with full size fridge/freezer and high stools at breakfast bar. Longue area with settee, armchair, 50" TV, table and 2 dining chairs. Bedroom with King bed, large chest of drawers, large TV, dressing area with vanity unit. Bathroom small but perfectly adequate. Walk in wardrobe and storage room with iron etc and safe. I have friends who live in smaller houses! 4 windows looking out on part strip. part mountains and a lot of construction ( but never a problem ). Security good as you have to use room key to access lift and outer door at night. Also security guard on duty in the lobby overnight. Nice gated swimming pool ( gain access with room key ) just steps from the main building with hot tub. Never very busy while we were there.
