No eating facility on-site but hey this is Vegas with a 1000 places to eat. It's located just minutes off the strip with no casino or slots. It's an oasis of calm after a day / night on the strip. If you want comfortable, spacious accomodation in a quiet area yet only minutes from the Strip then go grab it - you certainly wont be disappointed. It really is as good as everyone says it is!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: lonewayfarer
Reviews.Content: We came across this hotel during a road trip, part of which was to visit Las Vegas. We wanted a hotel that was fairly inexpensive but was close to the Las Vegas strip. This hotel definately delivered on those requirements. On arrival at the hotel we did discover that there was some refurbishment work happening in the reception area that we did not expect but were relieved to discover that the work was being conducted only in that area. A temporary reception had been set up in an adjoining room to the lobby. The reception staff were polite, professional and neatly turned out. Check-in took only a few minutes. We were given an electronic room key and advised to the location of our room. When we arrived at the room we found it to be fairly spacious with a fully stocked kitchenette with all of the cutlery, dishes, plates and cooking untenstils. There was also an ironing board, iron, hairdryer, tv, clock radio and air-con unit. Someone could quite easily stay here self-catering but we were only staying one night. The room we booked had two queen sized beds, a comfy chair and a table. There was also a bed-side cabinet. The bathroom and shower area were clean and tidy with clean towels and some complimentary touches like soap, shampoo, etc. What was really great about this hotel was it's location in relation to the Las Vegas strip. It is literally about a block away to the strip but we were paying a reasonable price. I would definately recommend a stay here for those on a budget who was to see Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Grunzgurke
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly very helpful staff. Nice large rooms with kitchenette. Very good value. We highly recommend the dinner buffets in Planet Hollywood (nearby) and Rio Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Clean, Comfortable Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aa22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights while I attended a work conference and were VERY pleased with our stay. The hotel is a short drive from the airport (less than 10 minutes) and a very short walk to the strip (1 block). The hotel is right next to Planet Hollywood and almost "center strip" in my opinion (although it is a long walk all the way up to the north end of the strip). The hotel lobby was under construction when we were there, but even so was still clean and well kept. Security in the hotel was also very good as you need a keycard to get in to the hotel after 10pm and you must have a keycard to use the elevator. When we arrived we were told that they did not have a non-smoking deluxe suite available (I guess I had failed to request a non-smoking room). I told them that we had to have a non-smoking room (the problem was we were leaving on a Saturday and the system would not let them give us a room as they were booked for the weekend). So he talked with the manager and we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite at no extra charge - wow! What a room and what a deal! My husband and decided after seeing the room that we would definitely choose that hotel and a one room suite if we ever go back to Vegas with kids in tow. The room was huge! There was a full kitchen (fridge, dishwasher, freezer, sink, microwave, coffeemaker, stove - no oven though), a living room with sofa and TV and pull down sleeper bed, and a bedroom with a king size bed, TV, and walk in closet. The room was truly HUGE. The bathroom had a sink inside and a second vanity in the bedroom. Everything was clean and well kept. I'm easily disgusted by hotel rooms and I felt very comfortable here. There is no wi-fi like the website advertises, but there is a high speed DSL connection that you can connect to in room - bring your own cable though. The grocery store is not within walking distance, but would probably just be a short drive or taxi ride away. We just bought a few things from the walgreens and CVS about 1-2 blocks away. Overall, we were very happy with our stay and plan to return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: Gert123
Reviews.Content: Fantastic, my favourite hotel out of the 5 different ones we stayed in during our Summer holiday. This non gaming hotel is located in a great position just 5 minutes walk from the strip. Close enough to walk to all the major attractions but far enough away from the noise and crowds. We booked a suite which had a fantastic huge bedroom with walk in wardrobe & additional wash basin. The living room had a sofa bed for the kids and there was a kitchenette with microwave, fridge, kettle, hob etc. All staff were helpful and polite, providing additional recommendations for takeout and eateries and calling our room when the food arrived. Very useful laundry facilities on site and a small shaded pool with masses of pool towels which the kids made good use of. We loved Vegas, and this fabulous hotel made it even better.

Reviews.Title: “Just off the strip but still well located”
Reviews.Author: PaulSomewhere
Reviews.Content: We paid $150 a night, staying 3 nights, and after being a little disappointed at first in getting a smoking suite (our choice,better option with the beds) we enjoyed our stay. You are about 5 minutes walk from the strip and taxis are easily available from the hotel if needed. There is also plenty of parking spaces. Our suite was large, clean and with everything in good order. Dispite what photos may seem to show , you have to walk out the hotel lobby and up some steps to the pool. But once there it's nice with a jauzzi and towels available. For breakfast we went around the back and into The MGM Grand, where for about $15 you get all food you could eat.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE - NO PROBLEMS”
Reviews.Author: Ray170
Reviews.Content: We had three nights in this hotel and found it to be good value, well located and had very friendly staff. The room was certainly comfortable and although the scenery from the window was limited it was quite acceptable. Quiet location particularly given its close proximity to the Strip. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Elainedavies
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from trip advisor reviews and we were not dissappointed. Location - superb, just far enough from the strip to walk but quiet and safe away from the hussle and bussle Pool - great for the kids, shaded, just what you need in 107 degrees Rooms - spacious and comfortable beds. Very clean. Have to say that each room very different layouts. Ours had huge kitchen and small bedroom whilst a friend had the opposite, directly across the hall. did have a few problems with our air conditioning, but maintenance came immediately Plus - Great to have washing facilities on site and a little supermarket in hotel next door was perfect. Kitchenette meant being able to have breakfast etc before setting out for the day. Recommend - Certainly. Was a good priced hotel in good location. Dont expect the Ritz, but a welcome relief from all the slot machines.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: RexMurcia_Spain
Reviews.Content: Well I have all praises for this oasis in Las Vegas. I cannot understand the negative reviews written here. I was given a wonderful room with magnificent view. Everything worked properly in the room, bathroom, and ktchen. Room service very efficient. Front desk staff and concierge superb. Very fast check in and check out. I was there for 14 days and I have not a single complaint. Every request was granted. And is a place very near the strip, surrounded by very tall buildings but this is not at all a problem for the use of the swimming pool, actually you can sunbath most part of the day. They arrange for you a shuttle service to make groceries at no cost and get you good deals for shows. As I said, I have but praises or this hotel and hope to return to it my next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Lymond
Reviews.Content: Used the Carriage House as our base for two nights in LV. Very positive about the whole place - clean, tidy, huge one-bed suite, with room for rollaway in lounge so teen kids (m/f) did not have to 'top and tail' on the sofa bed. Very quiet and handy for all that we needed. Easy to find on drive from airport. Good price when I booked (early). Would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, peaceful but very handy for strip”
Reviews.Author: LizRLondon
Reviews.Content: Went as trip advisor had recommended. Extremely pleased with it. Great location - 5 mins walking from strip and just off the middle so equally handy for either end. Reasonably priced, very large comfortable rooms. Quiet. No restaurant on premises just vending machines. However, miracle mile very near with lots of cafes etc or can order pizza delivery etc. If had to find something to complain about it is that their computer system seems a bit slow when you are waiting to check in/out and once it had crashed.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels on our trip”
Reviews.Author: bumpydog56
Reviews.Content: This was more a flat than ahotel as it had a small kitchenette, separate room for us and the kids. Great facilities, flat screen TV, good pool and very near the Strip, you could walk to most areas within 20 minutes. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cazzascorp
Reviews.Content: my 11 year old daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights in June 2008. What a little oasis in Vegas away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip and away from the gambling. The hotel is about 2 blocks from the Strip opposite the new Planet Hollywood hotel. It has a good pool that is particuarly nice in the late afternoon when the sun goes behind the Strip hotels. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room very comfortable and the inclusion of a mini kitchen was very useful. It is however a pity that the hotel has no breakfast facilities on site and I could not even get any fresh milk in the hotel. "also, unlike many other hotels, the internet cafe in the foyer was not free although if you brought your own laptop it was free to use in your room. Other than that, it is a good hotel and one I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great for family holiday”
Reviews.Author: suefromballarat
Reviews.Content: date july2008 reviewer Ballarat Australia Our family of four had the pleasure of staying here for 4 nights late june this year. It may not be as flashy as some of the other big hotels, but it certainly makes up for it in its service. the staff are very helpful and organised tickets to a show called O. We were very happy to find out when we were seated that we had 2nd row seats in the middle of the theatre. thankyou carriage house. this show was amazing and one of the best shows that I have ever seen. We had a room with a separate bedroom and a pull out sofa and a roller bed. the kitchen was like new with all the new utensils it offered.We enjoyed cooking two of the nights we were there. We also found that this hotel was great and well suited to families as there was no casino. it was one big block to the srip and very central to most things. Miricle Mile shops a block away. It was nice comming back to our quiet hotel after walking the busy strip. It is only 2 blocks to the Bellagio fountains and we enjoyed tea at the Bellagio one night at Noodles. This restuarant was a great find and we wished we had found it sooner. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent without any doubt”
Reviews.Author: udayverma
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great loaded with all the utensils you need for cooking ,cutlery,pans,knife,cutting board.Though we dint get at all to cook.The location is great between mgm grand and flamingo.it just two blocks away from the strip .Everything is perfect about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: goinonvacationagain
Reviews.Content: We had a 1 bedroom king room with a queen sleeper sofa in the living room,,,full kitchen which was nice...the room was very clean and comfortable...the hallways could use some paint and updating... They had coffee from 8-10am,,, Have internet access and pc with internet/printer to use at extra charge - which was handy as I had an emergency where I needed to print and fax documents. This place is within walking distance - about 2 blocks from the strip - which is close enough but far enough from the hustle and bustle of Vegas... The pool was nice as it was in the shade in the afternoon... We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but probably won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: mixtape100
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Carriage House through a timeshare exchange. It was close to the strip, but the extra couple blocks became tedious after 6 days of walking everywhere. Overall, the staff was very friendly and the room was nice. We were not able to get our room to cool below 75degrees. When it got to be more like 80 one day, we called for service and found out that the air conditioner had frozen. Even once they fixed it, it still didn't cool properly. In all fairness, they offered to let us change rooms, but with only a few days left in the trip, I didn't want to pack up all the stuff. I'm not sure another room would have been better. The pool is nice too, but only gets about 2 hours of sun a day since it sits between two tall buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised -- Great Value”
Reviews.Author: simplify
Reviews.Content: The Carriage House is one block off the strip in between the MGM and Planet Hollywood. Our room had a view of the monorail, which for us was entertaining. The one-bedroom suite was clean, well stocked, and comfortable. The kitchen was equipped with cooking utensils, pots, pans, plates, etc. The bathroom was stocked with extra towels. Most likely because the one-bedroom suite sleep 4 (one bed, one sofa bed). Since there were only two of us that meant more towels. The suite also had two T.V.s, three telephones, a full kitchen, a dining area, and a living room. Our room was on the third floor facing the monorail and we could hear the street noise at night. If sound is an issue for you I recommend a room on an upper floor or my favorite: ear plugs. The only downside was the lack of a restaurant or continental breakfast. The Carriage House does provide delivery (for a fee) from various take-out restaurants and grocery delivery. All-in-all you can't beat it for the price, location, and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: rockyandmickey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carriage House for 7 days/nights. It was in a good spot, right off the strip, maybe a 5 minute walk. This was a hotel with no casino which was kind of nice. We had a king size bed with a queen pull out sofa. There were 4 adults in the room which made it a little tight when getting ready in the morning, but other than that, it was fine. It's Vegas, so of course you don't sleep much, at least we didn't anyways. The room was clean and furnished. The hotel has a bus that comes on Sunday afternoons to take you to the grocery store, which was a nice convenience!! The hotel foots the bill for it...of course, you should tip the driver though!! One downside is the pool location. There is a large, very tall building that towers the pool, thus not allowing much sun over the pool for the sunbathers :( Overall, this was a pleasant stay and I would recommend for anyone. It was clean and simple.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with family”
Reviews.Author: Bladerunner76
Reviews.Content: Was in Vegas for a wedding with my wife and 16 month old son. We wanted a quiet no casino hotel and The Carriage House was perfect. The only thing I could find wrong was when my feet got a little dirty after walking on the kitchen floor .

Reviews.Title: “Best in las vegas”
Reviews.Author: Lisdar
Reviews.Content: If you want a first class comfortable hotel just off the strip near MGM grand and do not want to walk miles when entering the hotel to get to your room then this is the hotel very smart and good kitchen with all amenities lovely big room with good views over las vegas THIS IS THE ONE

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: cnderellen
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at The Carriage House. It's not luxurious but it is spacious, clean and comfortable. We had a living room, bedroom, full kitchen and bathroom. Great price, great location. Very near the strip (5 minute walk to Miracle Mile/Planet Hollywood) but away from noise and traffic. Staff was friendly, and conscientious. They went the extra mile to please. I would definitely return to this little gem off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely The Best Place To Stay In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveller0794
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carriage House in Las Vegas March 7-14 2008 while we were attending the Con Expo Convention. Abosolutely the nicest place we have stayed in Vegas...ever!! We traded our week through Interval International from our home resort to the Carriage House and our room was absolutely wonderful!! The nicest bed we have ever slept on in all of our years of travelling, and we have done plenty!! The room was absolutely spacious and the maid service was the best! We were told that the would clean the room, change the towels, but it was up to us to do our own dishes...they even did those too!! We were very impressed and will be returning to Las Vegas and will be staying at the Carriage House again. They have the best king size beds and the fluffliest pillows anywhere!! Everyone from the front desk staff, to the Concierge staff, to the driver who took us for groceries was absolutely accomodating!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but could be cleaner!”
Reviews.Author: LirpaAnn
Reviews.Content: Just completed a 12 night stay at The Carriage House. While the location was great and the suite amenities (full-size kitchen) perfect for a business traveler, I was extremely disappointed by the daily "maid" service. Aside from making the bed and providing new towels for the bathroom, there seemed to be little, if any, attempt to clean the rest of the suite. Vacuuming was clearly not a priority. Moreover, I don't think that they cleaned the bathroom one time during my two week stay. In addition, the pool was only open for the last four days of my stay. I would think twice about staying at The Carriage House again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: cirrus5461jyCANADA
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 (including 3 children) stayed at this property for 3 nights in March. We had a separate bedroom and a pullout sofa in the living room as well as a kitchen. Our spacious room and the hotel property was kept very clean. They provide you with tennis racquets and a basketball to play on their tennis court. The court and the swimming pool are a separate structure located above the parking lot. The pool was undergoing renovations this week, so we were allowed to use the gym and the pool at the Marriott hotel. We used their gym but not the pool. It takes only a few minutes to walk to the LV strip. It is within walking distance to the MGM hotel and right across the street from the Planet Hollywood hotel and their shops. New York, New York, the Excalibur, Monte Carlo and the Bellagio hotels are close by. The kids enjoyed looking through the M&M store (with a 3-D movie upstairs to watch), about a block away if you walk towards MGM. This is a terrific place to stay while visiting LV. I would recommend it to families and to larger groups of people who travel together.

Reviews.Title: “best holiday ever”
Reviews.Author: patLythamStAnnes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the carriage house in Jan. 08. It was a birthday surprise for my husbands 60th. I did not know what to expect, as i had read some poor reviews. Ican only say perhaps the people who were not satisfied must not have researched the accommodation and amenities on site before booking. The apartment was specious. With comfortable chairs and sofas.The kitchen was well equipped and had a dish washer.the bathroom was very clean with lots of white fluffy towels, shower only. The bed room was large as was the bed. And i must say, it was the most comfortable bed i have ever slept on on any holiday.Iwould return just for the bed alone.We had feather pillows and a pillow top mattress. Ensuring we had an excellent nights sleep.We were not troubled by building noise either. And there is a lot of it going on around it. It has not got a restaurant, or a bar. but we new this before we booked. But with plenty of food and drink outlets on the door step it is not necessary.the location of the carriage is excellent, just off the strip. All in all this was the best holiday i have ever had. It was great to escape to the carriage house for some peace after a noisy hectic day in vegas

Reviews.Title: “Unethical Business Practices”
Reviews.Author: cflcalgary
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Interval International by trading in our own time at our home resort. We booked for two weeks. The first week was a studio style hotel room. The second week, however, was supposed to be a 1 bedroom 1 bath style hotel room - clearly an upgrade from the first week's accommodations. The first week went without incident. When the time came for us to move into the upgraded accommodations, however, we had a number of problems with The Carriage House. First, Management at the Hotel claimed to have no knowledge of the upgrade. Once we produced proof of the upgrade, they appeared reluctant to honor the agreement, and stated "most people do not change rooms". Second, it became very apparent that the Carriage House had booked the second week of the 1 bedroom 1 bath style accommodation with another party. As such, they were unable to move us as requested. In order to dissuade us, front desk staff and management advised us that we would have to clear our room, wait in the lobby for six hours with our luggage, and see if the room was available, notwithstanding the fact that we had written confirmation from Interval International. Given that I am 69 years old and on oxygen, this proposal was unacceptable, and we were essentially forced to return to our studio style accomodations. In conclusion, we would not recommend The Carriage House to anyone that books through Interval International. We found their business practices quite deceitful and unethical.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, very nice place, very close to strip”
Reviews.Author: jw713
Reviews.Content: Very nice property very close to the strip. We decided to stay an extra night and couldn't find anywhere with an open room on a Saturday night with a big fight going on. They had a 1 bedroom king suite with a queen murphy bed available for a good price. I'll definitely keep this in mind for future visits to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: obob1
Reviews.Content: Traded a weeks time share for this hotel. Great location. People working there were great. Had been booked into a smoking room and needed a non smoking room. Even though they were full they managed to make the change. Quite and relaxing. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Service could be better”
Reviews.Author: Dennis D
Reviews.Content: We came here on our second week of vacation, on the way back from Maui. When we got there we were beat tired. We were given our room, a room with 2 double beds after we reserved a non smoker with a king. We were changed to a king the next day, things happen. The second day we were in our new room the tub/shower drain was backing up after my wife took her shower. I was given a key to take a shower in another room. When I returned the key, I was asked if I wanted to move to that room. I figured there was an issue there, so we did. The next early morning at 3AM the smoke detector went off chirping with a low battery alert. The maintenance man said they change the batteries only when they chirp. This is un acceptable. I wouldnt send an enemy here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect retreat”
Reviews.Author: WinstonPortsmouth
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Vegas (11-16 Nov 07) and were we glad we chose The Carriage House. The location is ideal, tucked in behind Planet Hollywood and the MGM, you are only a few minutes from casinos, shops and all modes of transport. After a long day investigating the big impersonal hotels and all the hustle, bustle and noise they generate, the Carriage House was our perfect retreat. No problem checking in here, spotlessly clean and very well sound proofed and the security first class. It was really nice to get back and have the facilities to eat and drink whatever you fancied, you don't always want to be bothered to venture out and find somewhere to eat. We used the hotels website to have groceries delivered to our room ready for our arrival. This was a wise move on our part, and the quality was ist class. After 21 hrs of travel we did not feel like searching for restaurants etc. Highly recommended and if we go back to Vegas the Carriage House is our 1st choice. Useful tips, take plenty of one and five dollar bills, useful for tipping and you lose less when gambling, take the taxi from the airport, only 13 dollars and is quick.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: dodge5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here both on the way to Hawaii and back, staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms a good size and clean. 3 minute walk to the strip, good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Surprise”
Reviews.Author: LCarpenter
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a long flight to be very pleasantly greeted by a friendly staff. The hotel itself isn't large but we were well pleased with our room. We had a view of the MGM Signature and the mountains in the distance. The hotel location was within a 10 minute walk to the main strip but not well lit at night. The facilities were excellent and included a very nice pool. Highly recommended for those wanting to relax a little away from the bright lights.

Reviews.Title: “great place if u want p&q”
Reviews.Author: davg35
Reviews.Content: i`ve been here before around 2 years ago and it hasn`t changed much.only complaint is they got rid of joey`s restaurant and bar on the top floor which were both excellent,why i dont know .so if u look thru rci`s description it is wrong. anyway, check in, a wee problem because my room wasnt ready for 4 pm,so check in staff were very helpful and upgraded me to a superior suite which was excellent.rooms spotless and maid service 1st class.the hotel is so quiet even with construction beside planet hollywood.which by the way is 3 mins walk and i just love that place.you are 5 mins from the strip which is ok,i didnt use the pool or tennis court which are really the only facilities and looked just fine.they do cheap tickets to steve wyrick magic show at planet hollywood but u can get them cheaper at tx for tonite,would`ve loved a place to have a drink b4 hitting the sack each night but it wasn`t to be, if you want a beautiful suite and friendly staff combined with a very quiet place to stay then this is for you.GET JOEY`S BACK IT WAS GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: happyrat
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the Carriage House Hotel and were VERY impressed. The location was great - a two minute walk from the strip and only a one minute walk to the back entrance of the Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood. We booked directly through the hotel website so got a 20% discount as an AA member (AAA in the USA). We only actually booked a room but were given a corner suite which was perfect; it had everything you could want - 42" flatscreen TV, massive bed, fully equipped kitchen (all sparklingly clean), dressing room with loads of hanging space, iron and ironing board etc. We also borrowed a network cable from the front desk so had free high speed internet access as well. All in all a brilliant hotel and unbeatable for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Carriage House”
Reviews.Author: Treeless
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at The Carriage House and loved it! It was quiet, even though they were remodeling and there was construction across the street. The front desk was friendly. The 1 bedroom suite with kitchen was spacious. Housekeeping did an excellent job of cleaning. The bed was comfy. The only wish we had was to have a breakfast restaurant closer to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Tuggie
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we have been to Las Vegas and it was very hot for July. The Carriage House is located in a prime area. Not on the crowded strip. It is in a perfect place. Not a long walk to the strip and across the street from the PH and the Miracle Mile Mall. The hotel was great. Very clean great staff. I love the idea of how to get to your room I felt very safe. Washer and Dryer on almost every floor was a big help. Using the computer was not so bad you knew that people would not be on it long. Thank you for making our 1st trip to vegas great! Yes I would love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: djcpbr
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay to experience Las Vegas! My husband and I were there the 2nd week of June, for a first time visit. The Carriage House is incredibly convenient to almost everything, and is a non-smoking, non-gaming suite hotel. We used our timeshare exchange and it was well worth it. The place is very well maintained and nice, with a small but perfectly adequate pool. The staff were friendly and helpful -if we ever come back to Las Vegas, we will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this place and would stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: ROADSTERGAL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week June 2-9 and loved everything about this place. The security is top notch. The rooms and common areas are spotless. We had a one bedroom suite and everything was brand new and spotless. It was large with a large bathroom, full kitchen, dining room and living room. The bedroom with king size bed was large and it had the most comfortable mattress that I have ever slept on anywhere. They leave you with loads of extra towels in the bathroom drawers and the huge closet has extra pillows and blankets. The staff is very accomodating and pleasant. I stayed at the Marriott Grand Chateau last year which is also suites/timeshare and I enjoyed The Carriage House so much more. They even clean your room every day which most time shares do not. I wouild never think of cooking while on vacation, but it is so nice to have the extra room. Alll the appliances were brand new. I cannot think of a negative thing to say. I would recommend this to anyone and I will stay here again on my next trip to Vegas. The location is convenient, too!

Reviews.Title: “Carriage house was a good time”
Reviews.Author: Javisdad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the carriage house for four nights over the memorial day weekend. Travelled with two kids, my wife and my mom. The rooms were huge and they had a kitchen. The pool was nice but outdoors and the Vegas sun is very intense. The hotel is very far from anything, it was very hard to get around, especially with kids. It was a hike to the MGM and the Planet Hollywood was nearby. It was hard to use public transport because it was far away (the monorail) or the traffic was so bad you might as well walk. My point is: Vegas is not for kids. The staff at the carriage house was very nice and went out of their way to be helpful. The place was quiet over the weekend, but the Marriot next door is under construction, so it was noisy during the week.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for above average room.”
Reviews.Author: onedohfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed there May 12-16. Like so many people I did not want to pay $200+ per night for a room in the new mega -deluxe "resorts." Going midweek is usually much cheaper, but they only charged an additional $27 for the Saturday night. I stayed at this hotel about 7 years ago and was happy to see that it has been kept up very well. With all the construction going on around it, the pool is closer to the hotel and the parking lot is smaller. But that is all for the better. This is a great location. Only 1 block to the New Planet Hollywood shops, 2 blocks to the strip. Rooms were very clean and staff was great. They took time to answer any question in detail. I like having the kitchentte in the room. I'm not a big breakfast person so the first day I stock up on some food. It is great to have a relaxing morning instead of having to get dressed just to go get something to eat when you get up. I had read some reviews about construction noise so I took ear plugs with me. Maybe it was just my room location, but construction noise was not a problem. I thought the noise would be bad while trying to relax by the pool, but that didn't bother me either. The air conditioner would be my only minor complaint...that was annoying. So I was glad I had the ear plugs. This is an excellent value for the size of room and location. It is by no means elegant or luxurious. It is a very good hotel. I hope it doesn't get squeezed out by everything going up around it. That seems to be the way of things in Vegas now...out with the old, in with the new. Let's hope they keep a few of the traditional hotels for us "regular" people.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Carriage House”
Reviews.Author: kcsdtypist
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Carriage House in Las Vegas for the last four days of our 11-day trip. This is a small hotel, nine floors, about one (long) block from the strip. Access to the Miracle Mile Shops is only one block away and a great place to cut through to avoid the heat of the day. Very conveniently located near the strip, it has free and ample parking. There is no casino in this hotel, so access to your room is quick and easy. All access into the hotel is monitored and the keycard must be used to enter the building after 10:00 p.m. and at all times to access the elevators. Great security! We had a king room with small kitchenette. Perfect for our needs! Came with everything we needed to cook simple meals which was a nice break after eating out for seven days in row. The hotel supplied everything needed in the kitchen, including coffee pot, micro, stove stop, fridge, towels, dish soap, etc. We received a room on the third floor away from the construction which is taking place around this hotel at an amazing pace. We were only disturbed once by the construction noise. Otherwise, it was a small buzz in the background, but nothing to disturb us. The room was immaculate. The beds were comfortable and had a cotton waffle-weave blanket instead of the velour blanket all hotels seem to use. The front desk employees were always so helpful. The pool was open until 10:00 p.m. and we enjoyed that several evenings after a long day on the strip and before we went back out for evening touring. They have a snack vending area which supplied us with ice cream treats at a very reasonable price (75 cents to $1.25). After paying $3 for bottled water on the strip one day, I could really appreciate the value of a ice cream treat for 75 cents!!) I would recommend this hotel whoeheartedly to anyone. At $70 a night, it's a value that can't be beaten by any "off-strip" property.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Lost_Detroiter
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Carriage House. Last year, we really wanted a suite hotel and saw some good reviews on this one on tripadvisor. This year we didn't really need a suite but decided to stay there anyway. It's right off the strip so you can walk to the Dessert Passages Mall (now turning into the Miracle Mile Mall) and the Planet Hollywood Casino (formerly Aladdin). We even did that last July and lived to tell about it. This is a great place to stay if you will want a break from all the crowds and dodging slot machines--it has no casino. The staff is friendly and helpful. We had a problem with the drain in the tub and it was fixed right away. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Carriage House - Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: woodsy528
Reviews.Content: Spent only two nights at the Carriage House in a one bedroom suite. Not much room in the dining/family room area with the sofa bed pulled out. No complaints about comfort on the sofa bed, but the pillows are foamy & stiff. Bedroom was quite large with a large vanity/sink area. Normal size bathroom with one sink & a bathtub/shower with very good water pressure. Every kitchen should be supplied with more than one frying pan. When cooking for four, this would be very helpful! Spent a couple of hours out by the pool. It was not crowded and was very nice and the water was warm but refreshing! The front desk was very helpful with requesting taxi service to the airport. Not fancy, but perfect for families and those wanting a little quiet time. Many of the best hotels and free attractions are within walking distance. Go on the Eiffel Tower at night to see all the lights!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, much construction”
Reviews.Author: Mary47
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed in a nonsmoking one-bedroom unit (524) April 2-5 and were quite comfortable. This southeast corner unit is very large, especially compared to a one-bedroom unit (stayed in by other family members) located on an upper floor in the middle of the west side. The room was clean and the pool was fine. The front desk staff were helpful. By unlucky coincidence, the road behind the hotel was repaved starting the night we arrived, so in addition to jack-hammering and asphalt truck back-up beeping, we had the inconvenience of difficult entry into the parking lot. The paving was complete by the time we left, but there are still huge construction projects next door and across the street. We enjoyed being near the Strip and almost across the street from the nonsmoking Desert Passage (Aladdin/Planet Hollywood) shopping area, which also gave us an alternative walking route to the Strip, connecting us right to the crosswalk to the Bellagio. One evening we walked from the Carriage House to the Monte Carlo, and down to Treasure Island. This is all within about 1 mile of the hotel. For our family, being able to park right outside, not having to walk through a casino, and having a kitchen are all strong recommendations for staying at a small non-gambling place. Construction is so widespread that next time I will be calling hotels directly and getting specifics about nearby projects before booking anything near the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the unit”
Reviews.Author: S1924
Reviews.Content: Booked a 2 bedroom, 2 bath unit through RCI on an exchange. We were very pleasantly surprised with the overall size of the unit and the decor. Although we did not use it due to the time of year, the hotel had a very nice pool and hot tub. Daily maid service was a plus, something we are not used to in a timeshare. Hotel was just 2 short blocks from the strip and across the street from the Alladdin. Very secure environment, snack machines just off the lobby, 24 hour manned front desk, security guard on duty, high speed internet access in each room, computer in the lobby. We had a very enjoyable time, would definitely recommend the hotel. Also, don't miss Fremont Street (downtown). We waited till our last day to go there and wished we had gone there first - affordable Black Jack and Roulette.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalTravelorCa
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with great location, a couple of blocks from the strip. It's next to the Aladdin. The suite was huge, 4 of us and we were very comfortable. Rooms were clean and very quite, heard no construction noise when we were there. It was great returning to our quiet room at night after all the noise and smoke of the casinos. Will definetly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A great place for longer stays”
Reviews.Author: DeeLittleHobo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carriage House for 7 nights in November 06 as part of a 2 week vacation in Las Vegas. The first week we stayed at a casino/gaming hotel (see my review about the Orleans Hotel & Casino) and upon our return from a trip to the Grand Canyon, we checked into the Carriage House. The staff were very friendly and even remembered that it was our wedding anniversary (I had mentioned it when I did the booking). We had booked a suite, and it was absolutely wonderful. There was a box of chocolates awaiting us on the dining table with a card which we thought was a very nice touch. The sitting-room area was really huge, with a big comfy sofa and large coffee table. There were 2 tv sets in the suite, one in the bedroom and one in the sitting-room area. The bedroom has a king size bed with good quality linen and spare bedding in the large closet. There was also an ironing board, iron and vacuum cleaner! There is a round dining table with 4 chairs, a breakfast bar with 2 stools and a fully equipped kitchen with full size oven, electric hob, dish washer, microwave, fridge and coffee maker. All the cutlery and crockery were spotless, and the frying pans, pots, bowls etc were reasonably new and in very good condition. They supplied us with dishwasher powder and washing-up liquid, tea towels etc. The only fault I could find with the suite is that the bathroom was small compared to other places we had stayed at, and there was no bath but a large walk-in shower instead. We weren't planning on spending more time than we had to in the bathroom anyway, so it wasn't that much of any issue. There is a pool and hot tub situated just across from the lobby and you need to use your room key to access the pool area which means nobody can just wander in from off the street. The pool was heated so we were able to use it even though the pool area was shaded for the large part of the day. There is also a tennis court, and although we did not use it personally, we did see some couples enjoying a couple of sets. The Carriage House is within easy walking distance of the Desert Passage at the Aladdin, where there are loads of shops and places to eat. A few more minutes walk takes you to the Strip and for those wishing to buy show tickets, it is advisable to get to the large Coca-Cola shaped ticketing booth around 10.15am. The shutters open at 11am but you will find that lines start forming very early. There is currently building work going on EVERYWHERE in and around Vegas, I have never seem so much construction work happening at the same time. This also means a lot of dust, heavy traffic and congestion in certain areas. There are also two large construction sites adjacent to the Carriage House and the workers start very early in the morning. If you are a light sleeper you may be disturbed by the noise, so much so that you can ask for a free pair of ear plugs at the reception desk. I did find, however, that after the 3rd night I got accustomed to the noise and it did not bother me that much after then. Otherwise there is really nothing to find fault with in this hotel. There is a laundry room with coin operated washers and dryers, and there is an internet access terminal in the lobby if you do not have your own laptop/notebook to connect in the room. I have no hesitation in recommending it to anyone who does not wish to stay in a busy, smoky, gaming hotel. If you're travelling with kids and want a more relaxing, quiet environment then this is the place for you. I will most definetely stay there again next time we head to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A nice respite from the hectic strip”
Reviews.Author: UpstateTourist
Reviews.Content: There is a lot going on in Vegas so you will find Carriage House a nice break from the action. The facility is clean. Staff very hospitable. There is a tennis/basketball court, fenced pool and internet access, concierge service, vending machines, parking on site. It is conveniently walkable to Aladdin and the Passage Mall. Plenty of venues for dining, convenience/quick markets within mall and on strip on block to the North. Other hotels are within reach as well. There are no gaming machines but you'll find them all nearby. The rates are very reasonable. You have a refrigerator, microwave and stove top to save you money and convenience to throw something quick together if you don't want to go out to eat. There are a number of construction projects within Las Vegas that may cause some inconvenience not just to this hotel but a number of others in the area. You'll find this property a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Beware with cancellations”
Reviews.Author: ifiwereu
Reviews.Content: We made and then cancelled the reservation using the hotel's website. Had e-mail confirmation for both. HOWEVER.....they charged us 1 nights stay anyhow.....took three phone calls to get a credit. They just happened to have overlooked the cancellation!

Reviews.Title: “Beware--it is a timeshare!!”
Reviews.Author: angeleyes27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carriage House in Las Vegas over the 4th of July weekend. It came highly recommended according to Trip Advisor users, but we were very disappointed. The staff had told us that it was only a block and a half from the strip and I thought that my teens would have an easy time getting back and forth to the strip. But it was a very LONG block and a half with road construction almost the entire way so you had to walk in the street. Every time that you got in the elevator, you had to use your room and make sure buttons were pressed at the right time or you weren't going anywhere. It can be a challenge if you are carrying anything in your hands. I needed ice. They only had ice on the 9th floor for the ENTIRE hotel!! When I went to get the ice, the floor was in total darkness and I was afraid to get it. The staff was fine and the kitchen area was nice enough and clean. The pool was just a regular pool, but you had to cross the parking lot to get to it. I was happy that that they had a hot tub. No one told me that this is a time share property and that explains some of it. But I would NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding Staff”
Reviews.Author: caralex
Reviews.Content: I checked into the Carriage House for 4 nights to celebrate a pre birthday in Vegas with a friend. The rate was great and the place is okay - definitely in need of updating which they are doing as we speak. As there is construction on 3 sides of the property we asked for a quiet room. The non-smoking room was ended up with was okay, but had been smoked in - even though they make you sign agreeing to pay a penalty if you do so. I needed to do work and the modem was on the bedstand but quick work by the maintenance staff and the modem was moved across the room. The staff also changed out every piece of linen in the room and put in an air cleaner to rid the room of smoke and odor. They even gave me a box of candy for my birthday! The location is 2 blocks away from the Desert Passage entrance and we never felt scared or nervous about walking. While the hotel needs to spruce itself up - the staff did everything they could to make my stay Fabulous!!

Reviews.Title: “Better value than a casino hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelalot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in August and we were very pleased. It is a short walk back from the strip but the benefit of space and a kitchen made up for it. I could not have stayed in a casino hotel, they were too big and I will not queue for breakfast. Our room was one of the newly refit ones and it was very good. Even the towels and bath mat was fluffy and new. Some reviews say the old rooms are a bit tired but this refit will soon be complete so do not let this put you off. I liked the fact you had to use your room key in the lift, no one could just wander in. The only complaint was the cost of a very short call to the UK was $45 (£25) Vodaphone network does not work in Nevada or Arizona so be warned if travelling with this mobile network from the UK If we return to Vegas we will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A Vegas oasis”
Reviews.Author: writespeak
Reviews.Content: When you spend time at other hotels in Vegas (as we did working at a conference), you appreciate The Carriage House more. You don't have to walk 10 to 15 minutes inside the hotel to your destination -- the elevators are just a few steps from the lobby entrance. We were grateful not to have to walk through a smoky casino at the start and end of each day. And being able to make our own breakfast instead of standing in line at a restaurant every morning was a treat. The staff were friendly, helpful, and fast when little things came up. We had a suite for less than the cost of a room on the Strip, and we enjoyed having a fully equipped kitchen and a living room to relax in as well. We recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be close to the Strip but away from it too and who appreciates the conveniences of a kitchen and a normal-size lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: egremont
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Carriage House for 2 nights at the end of our 2 week holiday visiting Mammoth,Lee Vining,Yosemite,Beatty and Death Valley.We were notified previously about construction work around hotel but were told it was from 7.00am.Our first day was Independence Day therefore no work but the second morning work started at 4.00am!! Wasn't worth asking for move as only there for 2 nights but just a warning! Room was fine but bathroom very small by American standards.Pity no where to eat in hotel and pool was small .We had stayed at the Tuscany Suites for 3 nights at the beginning of our trip and that hotel was cheaper and much better,with dining facilities and much nicer pool and surroundings. Wouldn't stay there again altho' I agree friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant suprise”
Reviews.Author: Capri1
Reviews.Content: Just got home and felt I needed to tell all the readers of this site. Stayed for a week at the above, read all the forums before we left and was looking forward to it, and guess what, it was very good. Arrived early at resort but unlike others we were not checked in until 4pm. Room 405, if you get it, refuse, if you want daylight and a view, tops of palm trees right on glass shame really as room excellent. Asked a move and got one after 3 days, upstairs to 517 a similar room with daylight and views of 15 hotel/casinos. Staff and all facilites were very good I have no complaints at all. Nice pool, free coffe 6 to 10am. Welcome meeting full of good truthful facts and no hard sell of excursions or timeshare. Took the advice of the concierge and ate at MAX's in Desert Passage opposite and boy o boy what a deal Breakfast and lunch $3.99 menu was more than acceptable, use it. Overal a great week, well located 5 min walk to desert passage and the strip. Room serviced every day - other residents all approachable and friendly made lots of new friends and we will be returning this year. Keep it up Carriage House.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a week stay”
Reviews.Author: tyler-hull
Reviews.Content: Firstly, yes it was disappointing that Joeys was closed. After travelling for a total of 18 hours we were looking forward to it, but never mind. The hotel is perfect for a group of friends who were staying in Las Vegas. we had a one bedroom suite which had a double sofa bed, 2 single sofa beds, and a double bed in the bedroom. the kitchen was very well equipped with fridge/ freezer, ice machine, microwave, coffee maker etc etc. the swimming pool was a nice size and jacuzzi was very inviting. Location was great, 10 minute walk from either the aladdin or the mgm (and monorail station). The building work never affected us as the windows blocked the noise. All in all a great choice for a weeks holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but where did Joey's Bistro Go!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had read previous reviews of this hotel and decided to stay there due to its location along the strip. I arrived to the hotel early around 10am and the guest services clerks for the hotel where excellent and friendly. They were able to get us a room early and the room was very nice. The room faced the new construction being built but i was not bothered by it as i could barely hear the noise with the windows closed. The pool was also very nice and well kept. I arrived the weekend of the 28th of April. The hotel is a block away from the strip and the walk is a short one to the strip next to the Aladdin Hotel. I would recommend eating at the Harley Davidson resturant if you get the chance as the food was reasonably priced and very good. I was disappointed to see a sign in the hotel that stated Joeys Bistro was closed indefinately. I wished i had known that prior to booking the hotel since there is nowhere to eat in the hotel. I would of liked at least a continental breakfast at the hotel since the Bistro is not open now. I would stay at this hotel again as i enjoyed my stay and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “First impressions can be wrong!”
Reviews.Author: swiss-mike
Reviews.Content: Our first impression of the Carriage House was not good. Its at least twenty years since I last drove in Las Vegas and it took over an hour to drive the couple of miles from the Airport- managing to miss the Carriage House by a block on at least three attempts. At the moment the hotel is surrounded by large building sites so the first impression is not good. Happily this impression was wrong,once inside, the building work is not a problem. We had a suite on the top floor that just been renovated - all brand new furniture and fittings. The staff are friendly and very helpful. The Carriage House is very well situated only about 100 metres from the entrance to the Passage Mall under the Alladdin and easy walking to most strip attractions,its also nice to be a little way from the crowds on the strip. If you need a Taxi go into the underground parking area under the Alladdin there is a taxi rank there. Taxis dont seem to like coming to the hotels so its better to go out and find one.We will certainly stay at the Carriage House again when we are in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel great, taxi service very poor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Carriage house is the perfect hotel in every way IF you have your own transportation or are walking to your destination. If you need a cab this is not the hotel for you. The average wait for a taxi is between 20-45 min. Not cool if you need a ride to the airport to catch your plane. A hotel shuttle service would have been helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation-Non gaming hotel”
Reviews.Author: akumalinfo
Reviews.Content: Staying just off the central strip at The Carriage House was a good family hotel. The suites were large with living room, dining area, and full kitchen. There was a heated pool and jacuzzi. Being a non-gaming hotel the place was lovely and quiet, a good place to rest after a full day of sensory overload. Friendly staff, and a good family restaurant on the top floor of the hotel, Joey's. Rates were very reasonable and location excellent.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be Back”
Reviews.Author: ddbmmd
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in a 1 bedroom suite in The Carriage House in early March 2006. The hotel staff was very friendly upon our check-in and when we opened the door to our room we knew we hit the jackpot (we weren't in Las Vegas to gamble). We found the place to be extremely clean. It had plenty of room space especially when you consider it had a queen size pull out sofa and 2 twin size pullout oversize chairs, as well as a full compliment of linen. The kitchen had a full size refer with ice maker, stove, dishwasher and microwave. It was well stocked with glassware, pots, pans, etc. The kitchen table and 4 chairs were clean and sturdy. The bathroom was large, handicapped ready. It even had an in-room safe. All this and only 1 block from The Strip. We never moved our car the entire time we stayed at The Carriage House. However, there is some concern over the construction noise going on across the street (in that whole area). It did wake me in the early hours of the morning, however, it didn't seem to bother my wife or two sons. Regardless, our next visit to sin city will be The Carriage House.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to the good reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was a busy weekend that we stayed here so a lot of the casinos were sold out. I stayed with a single friend of mine for a weekend getaway from the kids and significant other so we wanted to be close to the strip and able to go out easily without hassling with shuttles. The location was great, right behind the Aladdin Desert Passage mall, within easy walking distance to Las Vegas Blvd (the strip). The room was large and comfortable and very clean, well stocked with towels of all sizes and shampoo/lotion etc. The pillows were great, very fluffy for hotel pillows and the beds were firm but comfortable. There was lots of closet space, an iron w/ ironing board and enough hangers for both of us and our multitude of outfits for going out. The shower was GREAT! Hot water and lots of water pressure, better than my shower at home. They even had a real bathmat in the bathroom, not just the towel ones. The kitchenette was nice for eating leftovers for breakfast (PF Changs in the Aladdin has take-out which is great for next day or late night munching). Overall I was very pleased and will most likely be staying there again when I go back to Vegas with my husband. I would highly suggest this place for families with kids. On another not so busy weekend I would probably have stayed in a casino resort simply because we were two gals wanting to go out and party, but for a longer stay or with family I'd recommend the Carriage House.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Perfect location. Top staff.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Marvellous location. Excellent, friendly, helpful staff. Rooms are great with a well equipped kitchenette. Free internet connection for your laptop. Large carpark. Easy walking to the strip. We stayed for two weeks and will be going back. You should definitely consider this place if you don't want to walk through a noisy casino every time you go out or come back. The alladdin desert shops are just across the road with tons of eating places, great shops and an indoor thunder storm!! Try the Todai buffet. Grab a Las vegas guide magazine before you do anything and collect all the coupons; you'll save a lot on eating and shows.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: AJinVA
Reviews.Content: I chose the Carriage House after reading the great reviews on TripAdviser and was a little disappointed. There's no question that if you're staying for more than three nights, it's a good bargain - especially having the kitchenette to help keep costs low. If you've got kids and want away form the casinos it would also be a good choice. But overall the place seemed in need of a refurb. Two little things that were annoying and made our stay less comfortable were the hot/cold control in the shower and the a/c in the room. In the shower it had a weird hot/cold know that showed you temps - which would be great except everything 80 and over felt the same - and it all felt like 110! Why have the temps if they don't match the water? And the a/c unit didn't have a low setting - the air came out from a vent on the ceiling, and when it came on I could feel a wind across the room laying in bed. Don't know if I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: white feather 1965
Reviews.Content: After SFO our next stop was Las Vegas to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversay. A 2nd honeymoon without the 3 kids! The Carriage House was great. 5 minute walk to the strip or easy access through the Desert Passage of the Aladdin Casino. The apartment was fantastic. King bed, roomy lounge room, big kitchen, very workable and dining room. The only blight was the small bathroom. Very difficult to manouvre in! Staff was friendly and extremely helpful, assisted us in renting a car through Budget to enable us to drive out to the Grand Canyon. Vegas was amazing! The lights, the casinos, the restaurants, the people, smiling faces and the shopping was sensational. Would recommend the chicken pizza from Joey's Restaurant, we had room service one night after a hectic day of walking along the Strip. Vegas was everything we had dreamed of........

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for toddlers, pregnant mums and in-laws!!”
Reviews.Author: vegasvirigins
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved the one-bedroom suite, plenty of room for my husband and I, our 2-year-old AND my parents!! We stayed for 5 nights and found the location absolutely perfect for what we wanted in Vegas which was a shopping and sight-seeing, non-gaming holiday. Not only did we have the 2-year-old but I was also 3 months pregnant (and feeling sick) and still there are NO COMPLAINTS about the distance from the hotel to the strip - we walked everywhere in Vegas! Compliments to Joey's Bistro upstairs for the lovely "traditional" Thanksgiving dinner - the service staff were fabulous with our daughter! Just a tip: Use The Deuce bus service to get around places that are too far to walk. And, take a visit to the Las Vegas Outlet Centre if you want some good bargain shopping! Thanks again Carriage House - if we ever come back (WITHOUT THE KIDS) we will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: meklet
Reviews.Content: This is a vacation rental/timeshare located just off the strip between MGM and Aladdin. the one bedroom units are very nice about 650 sq feet. Full kitchen (fridge, stove, micro, dishwasher), big living room and bedroom. Furniture is very nice. Layout is good with breakfast bar, dining for four, couch, armchair, tv, two phones. Wish they had bath tubs but whatever. High speed internet is part of the package. No timeshare sales crap whatsoever. Laundry on each floor. Good service.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain Hotel near the Strip”
Reviews.Author: BornTooLoose
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for two days around Thanksgiving and enjoyed it very much--good location an easy walk from MGM Grand, Aladdin, and other attractions toward the southern end of the Strip--a hike to the far end, including Treaure Island (where we saw a show). Staff very nice, beds comfortable. They gave housekeepers Thanksgiving off--a fine thing to do--we didn't mind an unmade bed for a good cause. Good place for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Carriage House for our honeymoon from October 15 to October 22. Our first impression was that the studio room was beautiful. The king sized bed was comfortable and the decor was excellent. No flower drapes or bedspreads in sight. The kitchen was well-equipt. The strip was definately in walking distance, 5-10 minute walk, but found that there was much more action at the other side of the strip, so we tended to park our rented vehicle at a hotel and then tour the closest ones each day (parking is free at all hotels). Problem with the hotel? There were a few. First, housekeeping is definately lacking. Hairs were left in tub and on sink numerous days. Carpet needed a good shampoo, and I don't believe it was vacuumed more than twice for the week we were there. I spilt some pop on the sheets day 3 and they weren't changed until day 5. Second, though most of the staff where very nice, one night we decided that we would like to rent a movie so we called the front desk. The lady told us that we decided to not have access to movies when we checked in. When we told her no one meantioned movies to us, she basically said that we were lying because it was right in her computer. (why would we do this?). Anyways, we thought it would be pretty easy to flick a switch, but I guess not, since she rudely told us to turn the tv off and wait a few minutes. We did this, the movie didn't come up, and we gave up, rather than call her back and deal with her. Thirdly, the pool really lacked cleanliness, used towels were constantly piled to the brim of the bin, ash trays not emptied, etc. Construction seemed to be a problem for some guests but not us, since we were on the other side of the building. The nicest thing about this hotel was the lack of casino and the fact that you didn't have to walk miles to your room. It was very quiet and we did not hear any noices, people, etc. in the hallways late at night or anything like that. Overall, a good hotel if your looking for a cheaper stay in Vegas, but don't expect anything glamerous.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: fanman1965
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this fantastic hotel with my husband in november 2005 for 5 nights. Had a one bedroom suit which was brilliant, very spacious complete with TV in lounge and bedroom, 6 seater dining table, fully functioning kitchen (fridge freezer, dishwasher, cooker, toaster, coffee maker, kettle). The rooms were very clean and well furnished as was the hotel in general. The staff were very friendly and helpful and check in took minutes as we were the only guests checking in at the time. This was great as during our stay we witnessed check in queues at other hotels which were miles long! The hotel is minutes from the strip and a great location. The construction work around the hotel is still ongoing but we were on the other side of the hotel so we never heard a thing. It is worth requesting a quiet room when booking. There is construction work going on all over Vegas so hard to avoid really. The hotel had no casino which suited us. Walk into the lobby and straight into the lift, no having to walk miles through a casino to the room. I have stayed in strip hotels previously and can honestly say "never again". The carriage house offers a fantastic little hotel in a great location for less than the strip hotels, most of which are no were near the standard of the carriage house! Lastly i couldn't leave without a mention for Joey's bistro in the hotel. It tends to close around 9 if not busy and most diners seem to go for dinner then head out so its busy earlier on and well worth booking a table at. Superb! We dined there twice in our 5 night stay. On one visit we met a couple who live in vegas who were regulars and knew the waitresses by name. So if the locals dine there its good enough for me. The whole experience at the carriage house was faultless and i would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A liittle Oasis - and great for kids!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and our two children stayed in one of the bedroom family suites at the Carriage House for six nights in October 2005. There was easily enough room for the four of us and the facilities were excellent; microwave, cooker, fridge, coffee maker, dishwasher (very important!) etc. with dishwasher liquid and coffee re-filled each day. Both the bedroom and the living room (where the kids slept on a large sofa bed) had TV’s, meaning we didn’t have to watch Sponge Bob all the time. We were on the second floor directly facing the construction site at the rear. Ear plugs made a big difference, but it was still possible to hear the beeping of the forklift trucks early in the morning – I couldn’t hear anything else though, not even the kids! However, it must be said the construction of the extension to the MGM is very much ongoing. One building was nearing completion, whilst another was only just beginning, with the piled foundations about half complete (poured concrete, so no pile-drivers) but probably another 9-12 months to go until full completion (my wife gave me a hard time for taking an interest, being a civil engineer!!). The staff are very professional and friendly and were always on hand to help. There was never more than one or two people being served at reception at any time, but always two staff on duty, meaning you never had to wait long to be seen. We arrived at 5.30pm on a Saturday and check-in took less than 10mins. We needed a car for a couple of days, so the staff arranged one through Budget (they actually pick you up at the hotel and take you to their depot 10mins away) which was $20 dollars cheaper than the same quoted by the Budget counter around the corner on the Strip and we also saved on the higher airport tax! Being a family with kids (11 and 8) meant we couldn’t enjoy all the slot machines and gambling (one of the reasons for choosing the Carriage House, since we didn’t want to walk though acres of machines to get to our room). What we liked as a family was the Desert Passage at the Aladdin, with its shops and family friendly restaurants, which really is, less than five minutes walk away. The kids liked the swimming pool which was never too busy. The pool is across the hotel access road (very quiet) in front of reception, but you need your room key to get in, so is quite safe. Also, next to the pool is the tennis court, which the kids really loved (they have smaller racquets if required) Since it's elevated, they managed to lose all their tennis balls, but the staff didn’t seem to mind – they probably enjoy going into the swimming pool to retrieve them! Other things we liked about the Carriage House; laundry on every floor with washing machines and driers (essential for families or those with few clothes); internet access ($5 for 20mins or $10 for 50min) – We used it every day with 10mins being the longest wait; Joeys Bar – it was busy with a wedding taking place when we visited, but afterwards was quiet enough for everyone to get a window seat for the great view. Kids meals were good value at $3.99 and we enjoyed ours, especially with a bottle of house wine (a good accompaniment to the ear plugs!!). All in all, a little oasis amongst the madness.

Reviews.Title: “Carriage House was great”
Reviews.Author: racrtom
Reviews.Content: The carriage house was more than we expected. We stayed from October 22 until October 29. We had a two bedroom suite on the 4th floor facing the strip and away from the construction. We never heard any noise from the construction area. The suite was large enough that we didn't feel like we were running into each other. We could have put many more people than the advertised 8. It was very large. You never knew that there were people in the room next door. We did go up to Joey's one evening about 9:00, but was told that they were closed. In the elevator and the room it says that they are open until 10:00. That was the only disappointment we encountered. The people that were working the front desk were very helpful and friendly. I would definitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Carriage House was perfect, from the cleaniness of the room, to the help from the staff. The rooms are spacious. I liked being a little ways off of the strip, it provided privacy. The heated swimming pool and the hot tub was wonderful. They provided a grocery store run and a full size, equipped kitchen. They provided coffee and danish every morning. I wish they had more hotels in different locations, I would definitely stay...........Had a blast both in Las Vegas and in the Carriage House. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great Suite”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The suites are fabulous. You can buy a few groceries and not have to go out for every meal. Located close to Aladin and MGM and are easy walks. If you rent a car there are several covered spaces and no charge to park. Don't forget the restaurant which has great specials each night and is much easier to get into than the casino restaurants. we will go back again when we plan to spend more than a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Carriage House”
Reviews.Author: ABQ1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several casinos in Vegas and found that the prices keep escalating and the Carriage House is a secret treasure. Quiet, comfortable, new and clean. When we were there last there was construction going on next door but everywhere you look in vegas there is construction. We just loved this place and are returning this week. I would advise getting reservations early though since it is a smaller place. You just can't go wrong. No smoke!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Carriage House is simply the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: Smugglers Cove
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Carriage House on a time share exchange from 10 September to 24 September. This is the second time that we have stayed there, the last was 4 years ago, and we were delighted to be returning to the Hotel. After reading the helpful reviews on this web site regarding the construction on either side of the Carriage House, we contacted the resort prior to our arrival and requested a room on the quieter side of the building, and we were allocated a lovely one bedroom apartment on the 8th floor overlooking the pool. We could see New New York Hotel, the Aladdin and part of Paris from our window. Our apartment was spacious with ample room for just the two of us, (there would have been plenty of space and privacy for two other adults as well!) and we loved the huge walk in shower!!! We agree that the noise from the construction would have been heard at certain times of the day when the building was going up, but the building to the front of the hotel is near completion. Our check in was easy, the staff knew us by name when we checked in, and just compare that to the horrendous check in queues that we saw at Caesar's Palace and the Bellagio! There were also lots of touches that we do not always find in time share apartments, such as ample dishwasher detergent and liquid, coffee left each day and even sachets of salt and pepper!! The in room safe was also very handy. The staff at reception were extremely helpful, nothing was too much trouble, and we could always find a sunlounger by the pool. The walk to the side entrance of the Dessert Passage in the Aladdin Hotel is only a 5 minute walkfrom the Hotel, and we enjoyed the shops and restaurants, especially the opening offer at Max's Grille, $3.99 for lunch specials and $6.99 for dinner specials!! We would recommend the Carriage House to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “just loved everything about the carriage house”
Reviews.Author: mkmeaaswell
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ the carriage house las vegas for 5 nights,this was the 1st stop of our 8 week around the world trip. The stay was wonderful. The last time we visited vegas we stopped @ circus circus as we had our grandaughter with us on that trip so apt for children but not for us. The carriage house is a non-gambling hotel and we liked this as you can really relax after a hard day walking around and enjoying all the delights of las vegas. Can't wait to return @ the end of the year and bringing my mother from Scotland and she'll love this place. SEE YOU SOON. Regards Liz

Reviews.Title: “Brits. view of the Carriage House”
Reviews.Author: Arkwright
Reviews.Content: Situated just 5 minutes walk from Las Vegas Boulevard this place is almost perfect. Our daughter arrived before us (travelling from Oz.)and was made very welcome. Checking in was swift after the long flight, and the room was well fitted and very clean. Although a little smaller than expected it served us well for the 10 days in Vegas. The kitchenette was ideal for light breakfast (couldn't face Denny's every morning) and snacks in the afternoon. The only annoyance was the early morning ( 3.30 a.m. onwards) noise from the building site next door at the MGM Grand. Staff were very helpful for shopping info., car hire and even supplying the right adaptor for mobile 'phone recharge. Didn't use Joey's Restaurant as smart dress was required and we were in shorts etc. Security good and free early (6 am. to 10 a.m.) coffee in the lounge was most welcome to combat jet lag. I wouldn't hesitate in returning, but for us Vegas is a 'Once in a lifetime' as other places beckon.

Reviews.Title: “forget the rest”
Reviews.Author: JasperA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Carriage Hse 6th - 13th August. Forget all the bad stuff you have read earlier, believe us. The place is excellant, staff friendly and helpfull and much better than one of the sprawling jungles with several thousand rooms. We had a great suite (top floor looking towards the mountains-although some of this view will disappear over the next year or so with the building of some taller buidings that are in the process of being built). It was very comfortable, in good decrative order and very well equiped. The building on the otherside of the property is nearly completed externally & they are landscaping the path next to it that you use on your way up to the strip which is no more than 5 minutes walk away at a gentle pace. Yes the builders do start early (4-5 am) but we were not affected by any noise. The pool is a mere 5 yards away from the front entrance and yes you have to cross the roadway to the front entrance but hey its not Monaco or some other grand prix circuit.The pool area was more than adequate and always had plenty of room, loungers and chairs and a very hot hot tub. We were not energetic enough to use the tennis court. Joeys was very pleasant and tried differant theme nights but was essentially a pizza restraunt. We enjoyed our only meal there. It proved a great base for us to explore Las Vegas and its surroundings and I would have no hesitation in recomending it to anyone who asked. The Carriage Hse arranged free trips to the supermarket twice a week, giving you a discount card as well. They also had a concierage service to help you with any arrangements for what ever you wanted. Although we didn't hire a car the car park always had spaces available.

Reviews.Title: “Close enough to the strip yet far enough away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel 1st week of August 2005. Situated not on the strip but only minutes walk to the Aladdin Passageway, which has shops and restaurants, and takes you through to The Aladdin Hotel and Casino. There is a lot of construction being carried out around the surrounding area but we were only woken up once in the night/early morning. Went to the restaurant on the top floor with some sights of the hotels on the strip, food was lovely with friendly staff. The hotel staff assisted us with all our queries including finding us the telephone number to book a trip to Alcatraz when we moved on to San Francisco. Rooms were quite big, and very comfortable, would have liked 2 bathrooms as there was 4 of us but we managed. Our only complaint was the air condititioning, it worked fine on the 1st day but then decided to pack up, when we complained to the reception they said it had frozen and to leave it off for a couple of hours. When we switched it back on it still didn't work so we informed reception again, and within minutes they sent a maintenance person to our room. He worked on the air conditioning for at least half an hour and replaced a part. It did work after this but not as good as other air conditioning we have experienced, with temperatures above 100 degrees it was uncomfortable to say the least. All in all I would recommend The Carriage Hotel and will definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not on the Strip, but close enough to walk”
Reviews.Author: Occasi0nalTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was generally nice, but there were a few problems. There was a tobacco odor in the hallway and in our room, which was non-smoking. However, it's probably hard not to have a smell of tobacco anywhere in Las Vegas. Also, we were woken up by some machinery making loud sounds at 3:45 A.M. There's a huge hotel tower being built next door, and the staff of the Carriage House told us that the construction often happens at night. Despite these problems, the room was comfortable, and the Strip is within easy walking distance. Other advantages were the safe provided in the room and the two elevators, which seemed unnecessary for a hotel of its size.

Reviews.Title: “You don't have to be the biggest to be the best”
Reviews.Author: jamtin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Carriage House as part of a Timeshare exchange. There were 7 of us including 3 children so we took a 2 bedroomed apartment. The apartment was very spacious, well decorated, well set out and with everything we could have wanted. The kids could play or watch TV in their own bedroom so never got under our feet. It was cleaned every day and the cleaners were very friendly and efficient, always ready for a chat and made our stay very easy indeed. Booking in was simple and quick, no queues and the reception staff were always excellent. Joey's restaurant on the top floor offered good food at a good price whether you ate in or took a take out. The hotel does not have any gaming facilities which was fine by us with having 3 children, besides the strip is only 200 yards away. There is building work going on outside as the MGM which is next to The Carriage House is extending even further, this work starts early and finishes late so outside it can get dusty and the road is busy with site traffic. However the noise created was minimal and not enough to spoil our stay. There is re-furbishment of a few rooms going on inside the Carriage House as well but again it did not affect any part of our stay. There is a pool outside the main entrance which is small but large enough to sunbathe and swim and play in. All in all, we enjoyed The Carriage House, the staff make the hotel and we would recommend it to any family which includes young children or teenages who are looking to stay somehere away from the hustle and bustle of the main areas of Ls Vegas.
